consensio: <entryFree id="n10462" type="main" key="consensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>consentio</etym>, <sense id="n10462.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an agreeing together, agreement, unanimity, common accord</hi> (in good prose; most freq. in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n10462.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium gentium omni in re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:13:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 13, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">firma omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:17:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 17, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta Italiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,018:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. Quir. 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla de illis magistratuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:15:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 15, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singularis omnium bonorum in me tuendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">universae Galliae consensio libertatis vindicandae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa voluntatum, studiorum, sententiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 4, 15</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10462.2" n="2" level="3"> As a figure of speech, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 51</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n10462.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae,</quote> <trans><tr>harmony</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 5, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10462.4" n="II" level="1"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">a plot, combination, conspiracy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 15, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 7, 16</bibl> (3, 6): <cit><quote lang="la">scelerata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna multorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 3, 3</bibl></cit>.— In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullaene consensiones factae esse dicuntur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:4:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 4, § 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10462.5" n="b" level="4"> In concreto, <hi rend="ital">those who have banded together, conspirators</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">globus consensionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 8, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consensus: <entryFree id="n10463" type="main" key="consensus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from consentio</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10464" type="main" key="consensus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consensus</orth>, üs, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>consentio</etym>, <sense id="n10464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">agreement, accordance, unanimity, concord</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in prose). </sense><sense id="n10464.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam major vester consensus in ullā causā fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 4, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si omnium consensus naturae vox est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:15:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 15, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 4 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantus senatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legionis ad rem publicam recuperandam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilii totius Galliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conspirans horum (fratrum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 12, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 7, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 5, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eruditorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grammaticorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum hominumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aevi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filiorum adversus patres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr 2:9:22" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr 2, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimo in rem publicam consensu libertatem defendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:17:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 17, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter malos ad bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex communi consensu aliquid ab aliquo petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 30</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">repentino maximoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 13</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. dissensus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 300</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:80" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 3, 80</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid apud Chattos in consensum vertit,</quote> <trans><tr>has become a general custom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10464.2" n="b" level="4"> Consensu, among the histt. after the Aug. per. freq. <hi rend="ital">adv., unanimously, with general consent, according to the general wish</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">comitiorum illi habendorum, quando minimus natu sit, munus consensu inpingunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:35:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 35, 7</bibl></cit>; and 3, 36, 5; 24, 37, 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ipsi invisum consensu imperium ... interpretarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:38:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 38, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10464.3" n="B" level="2"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">a plot, conspiracy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">audacium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sest 40</bibl></cit>. 86.—</sense><sense id="n10464.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanimate objects, <hi rend="ital">agreement, harmony, synpathy</hi> (class.): quā ex conjunctione naturae et quasi concentu atque consensu, quam <foreign lang="greek">sumpaqeian</foreign> Graeci appellant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:14:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 14, 34</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:11:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 11, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">concentusque mirus omnium doctrinarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consensus et conspiratió virtutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:23:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 23, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duorum antecedentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10464.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A common feeling, common life</hi>: neque enim poterunt (animae et corpora) suptiliter esse Conexae neque consensus contagia fient, Lucr 3, 740.</sense></entryFree>
consentanee: <entryFree id="n10465" type="main" key="consenta_ne^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consentānĕē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. consentaneus <sense id="n10465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
consentaneus: <entryFree id="n10466" type="main" key="consenta_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consentānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>consentio</etym>, <sense id="n10466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">agreeing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">according with something, suited to, becoming, meet, fit, proper</hi> (in good prose; most freq. in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n10466.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: quod quidem erat consentaneum <cb n="CONS" /> cum iis litteris, quas ego Romae acceperam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 6, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10466.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">formula Stoicorum rationi disciplinaeque maxime consentanea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:4:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors ejus vitae sanctissime actae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 7, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">g</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">actiones his (motibus, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:22:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 22, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hae disciplinae sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscura somnia minime majestati deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:65:135" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 65, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non necesse esse optumae rei publicae leges dare consentaneas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:10:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 10, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:20:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 20, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">his temporibus consentaneum genus litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: illa divisio illi, qui hoc proposuerat, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:106" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 106</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 7, 6, 1, § 8</bibl>: sententia utilitati rerum consentanea. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:6:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 1, 6, § 7</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n10466.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir vitā et morte,</quote> <trans><tr>consistent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:63:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 63, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">consentānĕa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">concurrent circumstances</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex consentaneis (argumenta ducere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:40:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 40, 170</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10466.4" n="b" level="4"> Consentaneum est, <hi rend="ital">it agrees with something, it is according to reason, fitting, consistent, proper</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n10466.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, with or without <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid consentaneum sit ei dicere, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 33, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum diceret, ei aliquid dicere consentaneum esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est consentaneum, qui metu non frangatur, eum frangi cupiditate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 20, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:15:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 15, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:9:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 9, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10466.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 31</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sentānĕē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in harmony with</hi> (late Lat. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">consentanee cum naturā vivere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">narrare aliquid,</quote> <trans><tr>according to truth</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Rufin. 3, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
consentes: <entryFree id="n10467" type="main" key="consentes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consentes</orth>, <sense id="n10467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">plur adj.</hi> [etym. dub.; prob. for consentientes; v Corss. Nachtr. 281; but, acc. to Müll., from sens, old <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> form from esse], only in phrase consentes dil (<hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> deum consentum, Varr L. L. 8, § 71 Müll.), in the Etrusco-Romish language of religion, <hi rend="ital">the twelve superior deities</hi>, called also dii complices (six male and six female; <cit><quote lang="la">acc. to the lines of Ennius: Juno, Vesta, Minerva, Ceres, Diana, Venus, Mars, Mercurius, Jovi', Neptunus, Vulcanus, Apollo),</quote> <trans><tr>who formed the common council of the gods, assembled by Jupiter</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 123</bibl></cit>; Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=70 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 8, § 70 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2119</bibl>; Inscr. ap. Ballat. dell' Instit. 1835, p. 34; cf. Müll. Etrusk. 2, p. 81 sq.</sense></entryFree>
consentia: <entryFree id="n10468" type="gloss" key="consenti^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consentĭa</orth> <itype>sacra</itype>, <sense id="n10468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sacred rites established by common agreement</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=65:11" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 65, 11</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10469" type="main" key="Consenti^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Consentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kwnsenti/a</foreign>, <sense id="n10469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the capital of the Bruttii</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Cōsenza</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 10, § 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:24:14 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 24, 14 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:30:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 30, 5 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Consentīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Consentia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 6</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 27, 50, § 115</bibl>.—And <orth extent="full" lang="la">Consentini</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Consentia</hi>, Cic Fin. 1, 3, 7.</sense></entryFree>
consentio: <entryFree id="n10470" type="main" key="consenti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sentĭo</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">cosentĭo</orth>; <sense id="n10470.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <itype>sensi, sensum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a</hi> </sense><sense id="n10470.1" n="I" level="1"> = unā sentio, <hi rend="ital">to feel together</hi>: multa (corpora, i. e. <hi rend="ital">substances</hi>) Quae neque conecti potuere neque intus Vitalis motus consentire atque imitari, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:717" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 717</bibl> Lachm.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">consentire animam totam per membra videmus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 153</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 104" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 104</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10470.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To agree, accord, harmonize with a person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing; to assert unitedly, determine in common, decree, to unite upon something accordantly</hi>, etc. (freq and class. in prose and poetry); constr with <hi rend="ital">cum, inter se</hi>, the <case>dat.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> of person; and with the <hi rend="ital">acc., de, ad, in</hi>, the <hi rend="ital">inf.. causā</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol</hi>. of the thing. </sense><sense id="n10470.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, with personal subjects. </sense><sense id="n10470.4" n="1" level="3"> In a good sense, with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: HONC. OINO. PLOIRVME. COSENTIONT. ROMAI. DVONORO. OPTVMO. FVISE. VIRO ... LVCIOM. SCIPIONE., etc. (i. e. hunc unum plurimi consentiunt Romanum bonorum optimum fuisse virum ... Lucium Scipionem), inscription of the Scipios, C. I. L. 1, 32: Wordsworth, Fragm, and Spec. p. 160; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:35:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 35, 116</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:17:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 17, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes mortales unā mente consentiunt, omnia arma eorum, qui haec salva velint, contra illam pestem esse capienda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:36 al" default="NO">2, 15, 36 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:28 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 28 al.</bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu quicquid ubique magnificum est in claritatem ejus (sc. Herculis) referre consensimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> de amicitiae utilitate omnes uno ore consentiunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 23, 86</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 9, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo de aliquā re,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 42</bibl></cit>. 131.—With <pb n="429" /> <cb n="CONS" /> <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consentire cum aliquā re, verbis discrepare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:26:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 26, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum his (oratoribus) philosophi consentiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 58</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illis superioribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 32</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 14, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi ipse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:22:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 22, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui parti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iis, quibus delectantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiis alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 65 al.</bibl></cit>—With <hi rend="ital">adversus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus maleficium omne consensimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:6:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus patrem cum amicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 11</bibl></cit>, ext. 3.—With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvo exercitu, sed ad benevolentiam erga nos consentiente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 18, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:23:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 23, 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 46, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 9, 18</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad rem publicam conservandam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad decernendum triumphum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:40:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 40, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad necem ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:50:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 50, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad indutias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 5</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in homine non, ut omne, omnia in unum consentientia, sed singulis membris suum cuique consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:32:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 32, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc non contumaciter consentio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">consentire in asserendā libertate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:60" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 60</bibl></cit>: puro pioque duello quaerendas censeo itaque consentio consciscoque, old formula of voting in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32, 12</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus ... censuit consensit conscivit ut bellum cum priscis Latinis fieret, old formula for declaring war,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32, 13</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">constat, ad alia discordes in uno adversus patrum voluntatem consensisse, ne dicerent dictatorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:26:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 26, 7</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc. rei</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consensit et senatus bellum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>has voted, decreed war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum erat consensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 32, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consensa in posterum diem contio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:38:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 38, 11</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si consenserint possessores non vendere, quid futurum est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 5, 15</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de prioribus consentitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter plurimos consensum est duas esse partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:12" default="NO">5, 10, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 7, 7</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">consensum est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:24:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 24, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10470.5" n="2" level="3"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">to agree to any wrong, to join in, to plot together, conspire, take part in</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque se cum Belgis reliquis consensisse, neque contra populum Romanum omnino conjurasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli faciendi causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:8:section=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 8, § 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem inflammare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod consensisset cum Hispanis quibusdam ... eum (Pompeium) comprehendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad prodendam Hannibali urbem Romanam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquem opprimendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod undique abierat, antequam consentirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 28, 4</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:49:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 49, 9 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10470.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, with inanimate subjects, <hi rend="ital">to accord, agree, harmonize with, to fit, suit</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n10470.7" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: sed mihi ne utiquam cor consentit cum oculorum aspectu, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 17, 52</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vultus Domitii cum oratione non consentiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:113" default="NO">11, 3, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:122" default="NO">11, 3, 122</bibl>: secum ipsa (oratio; <cit><quote lang="la">together with sibi constet),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:38:141" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 38, 141</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">precor ... ut vestrae mentes atque sententiae cum populi Romani voluntatibus suffragiisque consentiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:4:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 4, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10470.8" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(pulchritudo corporis) delectat hoc ipso, quod inter se omnes partes cum quodam lepore consentiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 28, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10470.9" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si personis, si temporibus, si locis ea quae narrantur consentiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:9:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 9, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:164 al" default="NO">11, 3, 164 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi ipsa lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10470.10" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 170</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:915" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 915</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:154" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 154</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio nostra consentit, pugnat oratio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicationem et statum semper consentire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 11, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi ab imo ad summum omnibus intenta nervis consentiat (cithara),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrumque nostrum incredibili modo Consentit astrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 17, 22</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10470.11" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sentĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., agreeing, accordant, unanimous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta rerum consentiens, conspirans, continuata cognatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:7:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus de laudibus omnium esset fama consentiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:17:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 17, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:58:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 58, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium omnis vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:25:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 25, 72</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> consentiente and -ti: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum consentiente auctoritate contenti non sumus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:39:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 39, 84</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">consentiente voce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 13</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">on the other hand, clamore consentienti pugnam poscunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:40:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 40, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10470.12" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">consensus</orth>, <cb n="CONS" /> a, um, <hi rend="ital">Part., agreed upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consensis quibusdam et concessis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:26:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 26, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consentium: <entryFree id="n10471" type="gloss" key="consenti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consentĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n10471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a council</hi>, the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sune/drion</foreign> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2120</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consepelio: <entryFree id="n10472" type="main" key="conse^pe^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sĕpĕlĭo</orth>, no <sense id="n10472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, sepultus, 4, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to bury with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consepeliri cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 6, 7, § 30</bibl></cit>: corporis morti consepeliri in baptismo. Hil. Trin. 1, p. 3.— <hi rend="ital">Perf. part.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">consĕpultus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">buried with</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 14</bibl>, n. 2 al.</sense></entryFree>
consepio: <entryFree id="n10473" type="main" key="conse_pio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consēpio</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">consepto</orth>, etc., v. consaepio, etc.</entryFree>
conseque: <entryFree id="n10474" type="hapax" key="conse^qu^e"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consĕqŭë</orth>;, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. consequus.</entryFree>
consequens: <entryFree id="n10475" type="main" key="conse^quens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consĕquens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, v. <itype>consequor</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
consequenter: <entryFree id="n10476" type="main" key="conse^quenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consĕquenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. consequor, <sense id="n10476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
consequentia: <entryFree id="n10477" type="main" key="conse^quenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consĕquentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>consequor</etym>, <sense id="n10477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a consequence, natural succession</hi> (mostly post-class.; most freq. in the jurists; never in Quint.): eventorum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:56:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 56, 128</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:5:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; most freq. in phrase per consequentiam, <hi rend="ital">by consequence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per consequentiam significatio est, cum res quae sequuntur aliquam rem dicuntur, ex quibus tota res relinquitur in suspitione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 54, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:3:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:1:5" default="NO">10, 1, 5</bibl>; so also in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">per consequentias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:8:1 sq" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 8, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:1 al" default="NO">47, 10, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
consequia: <entryFree id="n10478" type="main" key="conse^qui^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consĕquĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, = consequentia, <sense id="n10478.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a consequence</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:678" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 678</bibl></cit> Forbig. dub. (Lachm. conseqüe); and </sense><sense id="n10478.1" n="b" level="4"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a retinue, the rear guard</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> 5, p. 169</bibl>, and 10, p. 247.</sense></entryFree>
consequor: <entryFree id="n10479" type="main" key="conse^quor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sĕquor</orth>, <itype>sĕcūtus</itype> (or sĕquūtus; v. sequor), 3, <sense id="n10479.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10479.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To follow, follow up, press upon, go after, attend, accompany, pursue any person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi> (class. in prose and poetry); constr. with <case>acc.</case> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10479.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10479.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen. (rare). </sense><sense id="n10479.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consecutus est me usque ad fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me continuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te tam strenue,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope nos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras suas prope,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 10, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem gradu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10479.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: ita vos decet; <cit><quote lang="la">Consequimini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic se conjecit intro: ego consequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego rectā consequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitibus non consecutis,</quote> <trans><tr>without attendants</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:34:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 34, 97</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10479.6" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10479.7" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To follow after</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pursue in a hostile manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquas copias Helvetiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consequuntur equites nostri, ut erat praeceptum, Auct. B. G. 8, 27: consecutis strenue hostibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:4:34" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugientem (Servium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:48:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 48, 4</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita mihi videntur omnia, mare, terra, caelum consequi, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit> Fleck. Codd. (Ussing, concoqui).—</sense><sense id="n10479.8" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To follow, come after</hi>, in time: hunc Cethegum consecutus est aetate <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, Cic. Brut. 15, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sallustium (Livius, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:36:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 36, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">has tam prosperas res consecuta est subita mutatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cim. 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si haec in eum annum qui consequitur redundarint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:39:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 39, 85</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes anni consequentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:20:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 20, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquis consecutis diebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejusmodi tempora post tuam profectionem consecuta esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 5</bibl></cit>, a, 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 5, 8</bibl>: haec cum Crassus dixisset, silentium est consecutum. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:35:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 35, 160</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:8:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 8, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem consequitur aliquando, numquam comitatur divinitas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>after death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:5:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 5, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10479.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10479.10" n="1" level="3"> In gen. (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">minas jam decem habet a me filia ... Hasce ornamentis consequentur alterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his diebus, quae praeterita erunt superiore mense, opera consequi oportet,</quote> <trans><tr>to make up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:90" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 90</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n10479.11" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10479.12" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To follow a model, copy</hi>, an authority, example, opinion, etc.; <hi rend="ital">to imitate, adopt, obey</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Chrysippum Diogenes consequens partum Jovis dejungit a fabulā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:15:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 15, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum morem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:7:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necesse'st consilia consequi consimilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 35</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sententias (principum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum quoddam institutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:32:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 32, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exilitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:82:284" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 82, 284</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediam consilii viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:45:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 45, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10479.13" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To follow a preceding cause as an effect, to ensue, result, to be the consequence, to arise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proceed from</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus ab ipsis Consequitur sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 461</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:929" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 929</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:867" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 867</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 477</bibl>: ex quo fit ut pudorem <cb n="CONS" /> rubor, terrorem pallor et tremor consequatur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:8:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 8, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam eorum opinionem magni errores consecuti sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 16, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod dictum magna invidia consecuta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo illud naturā consequi, ut communem utilitatem nostrae anteponamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:19:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 19, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:2" default="NO">2, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia libertatem pax consequebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 13, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10479.14" n="(b)" level="5"> Of a logical sequence, <hi rend="ital">to follow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quod primum in conexo est, necessarium est, fit etiam quod consequitur necessarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:7:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 7, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 9</bibl>; cf. under <pos>P. a.</pos>—</sense><sense id="n10479.15" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (causa pro effectu), by following after any person or thing, <hi rend="ital">to reach, overtake, come up with, attain to, arrive at.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10479.16" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10479.17" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si statim navigas, nos Leucade consequere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in itinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; Pompeius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12</bibl>, A, § <cit><quote lang="la">3: fugientem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:48:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 48, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:9:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 9, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:8:10:section=16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 8, 10, § 16</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:722" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 722</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:672" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 672</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:143" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 143</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n10479.18" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si adcelerare volent, ad vesperam consequentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prius quam alter, qui nec procul aberat, consequi posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25, 10</bibl></cit>: Fabius equites praemittit, ut ... agmen morarentur dum consequeretur ipse, Auct. B. G. 8, 28 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interim reliqui legati sunt consecuti,</quote> <trans><tr>came up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 7, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10479.19" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to reach, overtake, obtain</hi> (cf. assequor). </sense><sense id="n10479.20" n="1" level="3"> Ingen. </sense><sense id="n10479.21" n="a" level="4"> With things as objects (so most freq.), <hi rend="ital">to obtain, acquire, get, attain, reach</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut opes quam maximas consequantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:19:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 19, 64</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">quaestum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 12, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplissimos honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 25, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam rem (i. e. regna),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum sua quisque spolia consequi studet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:9:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 9, 19</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec dubitat quin ego a te nutu hoc consequi possem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: ab aliquo suum consequi, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:1:9:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 15, 1, 9, § 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:23:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 23, 55</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructum amplissimum ex vestro judicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriosam victoriam ex rei publicae causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid commodi ex laboriosā exercitatione corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:10:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 10, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 42</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">per</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia per senatum (corresp. with adsequi per populum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 34</bibl>. —With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnem gloriam ... omni curā atque industriā consequare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 5</bibl>, b, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suis erga aliquem meritis inpunitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantam gloriam duabus victoriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 6, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dat. 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 19, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:102" default="NO">10, 1, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:7:68" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 7, 68</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid in dicendo consequi possum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac pernicie rei publicae ... gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:22:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 22, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Achillis gloriam in rebus bellicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 2, 5</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc consequi, ut ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec legum repertores sine summā vi orandi consecutos, ut. etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:125" default="NO">5, 10, 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:70" default="NO">8, 3, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:124:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 124, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 26, 3</bibl>; vix per matrem consecutus, ut, etc., Suet <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:12" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per quae si consequi potuimus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut hic Cicero consequitur, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 62</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: quibus ex rebus largiter erat consecutus, <hi rend="ital">made great profit</hi>, Auct. B. Afr. 62; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non quod minore numero militum consequi difficile factu putaret, sed ut, etc., Auct. B. Alex. 30, 3: non est turpe non consequi, dummodo sequaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:5:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 5, 4</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> as object: <cit><quote lang="la">vere enim illud dicitur, perverse dicere homines perverse dicendo facillime consequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 150</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10479.22" n="b" level="4"> Sometimes with a personal object, and with a thing as subject (cf. capio, II.), <hi rend="ital">to reach, come to, overtake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrem ipsam ex aegritudine hac miseram mors consecuta'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta prosperitas Caesarem est consecuta. ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 19, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si aliqua nos incommoda ex iis materiis consequentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 10, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. I. B. 2, b. supra.—</sense><sense id="n10479.23" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10479.24" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To become like</hi> or <hi rend="ital">equal to a person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing in any property</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quality, to attain, come up to, to equal</hi> (cf. adsequor): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem majorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:64:228" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 64, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullam partem tuorum meritorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 8, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad consequendos, quos priores ducimus, accendimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:17:7" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum prope numerum sententiarum numero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:13:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 13, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:90" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 90</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10479.25" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To reach</hi> with the sight, <hi rend="ital">to distinguish</hi> (rare): animalia <pb n="430" /> <cb n="CONS" /> minuta, quae non possunt oculi consequi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:12:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 12, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10479.26" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To attain to something intellectually</hi> or <hi rend="ital">by speech, to understand, perceive, learn, know</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">similitudinem veri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 3 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: quantum conjecturā, Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 10</bibl> (12), 4: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis illorum conatus investigare et consequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:16:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 16, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 8, 6</bibl>: omnia alicujus facta aut memoriā consequi aut oratione complecti. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:26:section=57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 26, § 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantam causam diligentiā consequi et memoriā complecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:12:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 12, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10479.27" n="d" level="4"> Of speech or lang., <hi rend="ital">to attain, be equal to, impress fully, do justice to</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">vestram magnitudinem multitudinemque beneficiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,018:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Red. Quir. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudes ejus verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 13, 35</bibl></cit>, cf. id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 270, 21</bibl>: omnia verbis, Ov M. 15 419; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:50:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 50, 129</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">consĕquens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to I. B.). </sense><sense id="n10479.28" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">According to reason, correspondent, suitable, fit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in conjunctis verbis quod non est consequens vituperandum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:6:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 6, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:75" default="NO">5, 10, 75</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10479.29" n="2" level="3"> Consequens est = consentaneum est, <hi rend="ital">it is in accordance with reason, fit, suitable</hi>, etc.; with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consequens esse videtur, ut scribas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:5:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consequens est, eos invitos non potuisse retineri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:77" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 77</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:23:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 23, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10479.30" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That follows logically, consequent;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">assentior, eorum quae posuisti alterum alteri consequens esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:8:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 8, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 7, 18</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid consequentius, quam ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 15:19" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trin. 15, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> apparently not in use.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">consĕ-quens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a consequence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneamus illud necesse est, cum consequens aliquod falsum sit, illud, cujus id consequens sit, non posse esse verum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:24:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 24, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consequentibus vestris sublatis, prima tolluntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 19, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:53:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 53, 215</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:12:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 12, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:66" default="NO">6, 3, 66</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">consĕquenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n10479.31" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">In an accordant, suitable manner, suitably, conformably;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prioribus dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:2:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:2:18" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 10, 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 257</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22</bibl>, n. 13.— </sense><sense id="n10479.32" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">In consequence, consequently</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> not in use.!*? <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: quae vix ab hominibus consequi possunt <foreign lang="greek">a)nu/esqai</foreign>, Orbilius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 791</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
consequus: <entryFree id="n10480" type="main" key="conse^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consĕquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>consequor</etym>, <sense id="n10480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">following</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pars paginae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Apol. 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. An. 2, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">consĕ-qŭē</orth> <itype>redeunt ex ordine certo</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:679" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 679</bibl> Lachm. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
consermonor: <entryFree id="n10481" type="hapax" key="consermo_nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sermōnor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n10481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep., to converse with one, to talk</hi>: cum iis, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consero: <entryFree id="n10482" type="main" key="conse^ro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sĕro</orth>, <itype>sēvi, sĭtum or sătum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (<sense id="n10482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> conseruerit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:4:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 37:3" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 37, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:1:38" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 6, 1, 38</bibl>; v. 1. sero). </sense><sense id="n10482.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To sow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plant with something</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n10482.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:52:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 52, 130</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:9:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 9, § 6</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ager diligenter consitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:17:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 17, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager arbustis consitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 53:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 53, 1</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">consitus an incultus (locus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ismara Baccho (i. e. vino),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineam malleolo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva frumento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:26" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 26</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alieno fundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:1:38" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 6, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alienum fundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:9" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 41, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10482.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva mūliebria (Venus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1107</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—Hence, conserentes dii, <hi rend="ital">who preside over generation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 169</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10482.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of columns, <hi rend="ital">to plant, set</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aera (rostra) columnis consita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10482.5" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(sol) lumine conserit arva,</quote> <trans><tr>strews, fills</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 211</bibl></cit>: consitus sum Senectute, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 4</bibl>: caeca mentem caligine Theseus consitus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 208</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10482.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To sow, plant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">olivetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:24" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc genus oleae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 24, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:2:22" default="NO">7, 2, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">zizyphum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Apr. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oct. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vitem) Narbonicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 43</bibl></cit>; Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 5, § 46</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10482.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (cf. I. B. supra): extra vallum stili caeci, mirabilem in modum consiti, <hi rend="ital">set</hi>, Auct. B. Afr. 31.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10483" type="main" key="conse^ro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sĕro</orth>, <itype>sĕrŭi, sertum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n10483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> consevisti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Ep. ad Ver. 8" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Ep. ad Ver. 8</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. a., to</hi> <cb n="CONS" /> <hi rend="ital">connect, entwine, tie, join, fit, bind into a whole</hi> (syn.: conecto, conjungo, contexo, etc.; class. in prose and poetry; most freq. in the signif. II. B., and in the histt.). </sense><sense id="n10483.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10483.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10483.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> with or without <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">lorica conserta hamis auroque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 467</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tegumen spinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 594</bibl></cit> (illigatum spinis, Serv.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 17</bibl>: monile margaritis gemmisque, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincula, quīs conserta erant vehicula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:1:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">conserta navigia,</quote> <trans><tr>entangled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scutis super capita consertis,</quote> <trans><tr>overlapping</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:3:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudis arbor conseritur (for navigating),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:512" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 512</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 136</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10483.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alium (truncum) alii quasi nexu conserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 5, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10483.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid juvat nocti conseruisse diem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exodia conserta fabellis Atellanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. exodium: virtutes consertae et inter se cohaerentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 3</bibl></cit>: ita ordo rerum tribus momentis consertus est, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:71" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonem,</quote> <trans><tr>to interchange words, converse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:12:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 12, 5</bibl></cit>; Fronto l. l.—</sense><sense id="n10483.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10483.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To join, connect, unite together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneros sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:36" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">femur femori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">latus lateri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10483.8" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to unite in hostility, for contest, to bring together;</hi> so most freq. manum or manus, <hi rend="ital">to engage in close combat, to join hand to hand, to join battle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa contulit, manum conseruit, magnas copias hostium fudit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 9, 20</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 50, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ages. 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:41:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 41, 4 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum cum hoste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=64" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 64</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 20, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:41:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 41, 19</bibl></cit> Dietsch;
