<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:40:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 40, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus cum imparibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hoste manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:39:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 39, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consertis deinde manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 25, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:60" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:50:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 50, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnam inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnam seni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:398" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 398</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:36:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 36, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:13:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 13, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:31" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella bellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 442</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:339" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 339</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">conserta acies,</quote> <trans><tr>hand-to-hand fighting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 35</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Mid.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis conseritur,</quote> <trans><tr>enters the fight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:50:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 50, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo acerrimā pugnā conserti exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—Rarely <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">levis armatura ab lateribus cum levi armaturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 4, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10483.9" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud ignotas belli artes inter se conserebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10483.10" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of judicial controversy: manum in jure or ex jure conserere, <hi rend="ital">to make a joint seizure</hi> (this was done by the litigant parties laying hands at the same time upon the thing in dispute, each one claiming it as his own): si qui in jure manum conserunt, XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:10:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 10, 7</bibl>: non ex jure manum consertum sed mage ferro rem repetunt, Enn. ib. § 4 (Ann. v. 276 Vahl.); cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=64" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 64</bibl> Müll., and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 13, 2</bibl>: ibi ego te ex jure manum consertum voco, etc., <hi rend="ital">I summon you in an action</hi> for possession, etc., a judic. formula in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 12, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:10:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 10, 41</bibl>.—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sertē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, from consertus, a, um (acc. to I. A.), not used as <hi rend="ital">P. a., as if bound</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fastened together, in connection</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia necesse est conligatione naturali conserte contexteque fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:14:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 14, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consertio: <entryFree id="n10484" type="hapax" key="conserti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consertĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. consero</etym>, <sense id="n10484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joining together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verticum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, p. 107</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consertus: <entryFree id="n10485" type="main" key="consertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 2. consero.</entryFree>
conserva: <entryFree id="n10486" type="main" key="conserva"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conserva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conservus</etym>, <sense id="n10486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a (female) fellow-slave.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10486.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:17:5 al" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 17, 5 al.</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">dat. plur.</hi> conservabus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10486.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">nolo ego foris conservas Meas a te verberarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duraque conservae ligna, valete, fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:6:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 6, 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conservabilis: <entryFree id="n10487" type="main" key="conserva_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conservābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>conservo</etym>, <sense id="n10487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be preserved</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">bonum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Mart. 2, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conservatio: <entryFree id="n10488" type="main" key="conserva_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conservātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a keeping, preserving</hi> (several times in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewh. very rare): frugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marii,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of his life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:10:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 10, 6</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: bonorum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriae, Num. Gallieni ap. Eckhel. 7, p. 408: naturae (with convenientia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 28, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 36, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequabilitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:42:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 42, 188</bibl></cit>. <cb n="CONS" /></sense></entryFree>
conservator: <entryFree id="n10489" type="main" key="conserva_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conservātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>conservo</etym>, <sense id="n10489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a keeper, preserver, defender</hi> (several times in Cic. and in inscriptions; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewh. rare): pro di inmortales, custodes et conservatores hujus urbis atque imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:24:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 24, 53</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so as an epithet of Jupiter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1225 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1629</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4982 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">istius urbis (with parens),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:45:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 45, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:27:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 27, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani nominis Augustus (with conditor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:60:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 60, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicorum (opp.: desertor amicorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conservatoris sibi nomen, Graeco ejus rei vocabulo, assumpsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10489.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A worshipper</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Nat. 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conservatrix: <entryFree id="n10490" type="main" key="conserva_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conservātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conservator</etym>, <sense id="n10490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who preserves, defends</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">conservatrices et nutrices ignis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, p. 151</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">As an epithet of Juno,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 25, 2 al.</bibl></cit>; cf. conservator; <cit><quote lang="la">and of industrious housewives,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4930 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum principum clementia conservatrix thensaurorum, Treb. Poll. Trig. Syr. 30, 16 (but the best reading,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:9:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 9, 26</bibl></cit>, is servatricem; cf. Madv. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
conservitium: <entryFree id="n10491" type="main" key="conservi^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-servĭtĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n10491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">joint servitude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">commune,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 2, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10491.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the fellowslaves</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 85, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conservo: <entryFree id="n10492" type="main" key="conservo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-servo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (<sense id="n10492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. perf.</hi> conservasse more usu. than conservavisse, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 21</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. a., to retain, keep something in existence, to hold up, maintain, to preserve, leave unhurt</hi> or <hi rend="ital">safe</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in prose). </sense><sense id="n10492.1" n="I" level="1"> Of corporeal objects; <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conserva, quaere, parce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 27</bibl></cit>; usu. with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conservasti te atque illam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placet his, simul atque natum sit animal, ipsum sibi conciliari et commendari ad se conservandum et ad suum statum et ad ea quae conservantia sunt ejus status diligenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:5:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 5, 16</bibl></cit>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar sese eos conservaturum dixit,</quote> <trans><tr>would save, leave unharmed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 15</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12</bibl>; 2, 28; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:17 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 17 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem familiarem diligentiā et parsimoniā (corresp. with augere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:24:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 24, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra arasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conservari alitem atque sobolem jussere haruspices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 40, § 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborem,</quote> <trans><tr>to preserve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chirographum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedia successioni suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:38:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 38, § 7</bibl></cit>.—With two <hi rend="ital">accs.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes salvos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquos incolumes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rectam conservare stirpem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:20:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 20, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10492.2" n="II" level="1"> Of incorporeal objects: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora quaedam conservant naturam semper eandem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:677" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 677</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 709</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pristinam erga me voluntatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pristinum animum erga populum Romanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jusjurandum,</quote> <trans><tr>to keep, observe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:28:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 28, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (benevolentiam) conservabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus augurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:35:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 35, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuorum meritorum erga me memoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:13:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 13, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,018:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. Quir. 7, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">religionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indutias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:ib. 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntatem mortuorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:47:section=124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 47, § 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:83" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">privilegia athletis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 45</bibl></cit>.—So the formula in treating for peace: majestatem populi Romani comiter conservato, in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:16:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 16, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 11, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:15:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 15, 7</bibl>, and v. comis, <hi rend="ital">adv. fin.</hi>—With double <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incorrupta mei conserva foedera lecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 3, 69.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">conser-vans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., preservative;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae conservantia sunt ejus statūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:5:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 5, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conservula: <entryFree id="n10493" type="hapax" key="conservu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conservŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>conserva</etym>, <sense id="n10493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small (female) fellow-slave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:21:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 21, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conservus: <entryFree id="n10494" type="main" key="conservus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-servus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n10494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellow-slave, a companion in servitude</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:64:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 64, 179</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:3:14:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 3, 14, § 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4598 al.</bibl>—In <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> conservūm, Titin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=270:20" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 270, 20</bibl> Müll. (Com. Rel. v. 132 Rib.).—Of a dog in relation to slaves, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 5</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi sunt, immo conservi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 47:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 47, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consessor: <entryFree id="n10495" type="main" key="consessor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consessor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>consido</etym>, <sense id="n10495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who sits near</hi> or <hi rend="ital">by a person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing, an assessor</hi> (several times in Cic.; elsewh. rare); <pb n="431" /> <cb n="CONS" /> in a court of justice, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:19:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 19, 62</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">at a feast,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 11, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:27" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 27</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but esp. in public exhibitions,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:54:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 54, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:7:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 7, 8</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dei Mithrae Dareus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. 1:42" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. 1, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consessus: <entryFree id="n10496" type="main" key="consessus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consessus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>consido</etym>. <sense id="n10496.0" n="I" level="1"> Abstr., <hi rend="ital">a sitting together</hi> or <hi rend="ital">with</hi> (only post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">communis ei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consessum alicui offerre,</quote> <trans><tr>the permission to sit with one</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18</bibl></cit>; so of permission to sit: liberum habere, Cod. Th. 6, 26, 16.—Far more freq. and class. in prose and poetry, </sense><sense id="n10496.1" n="II" level="1"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a collection of persons sitting together, an assembly</hi> (in courts of justice, the theatre; <cit><quote lang="la">etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:7:section=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 7, § 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 3, 12 al.</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:54 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 54 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 340</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 577</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus cum a cuncto consessu plausus esset multiplex datus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:18:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 18, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ludo talario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludorum gladiatorumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:50:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 50, 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:11:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 11, 22</bibl>; cf. in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">theatrales gladiatoriique,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 54, 115</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consideranter: <entryFree id="n10497" type="main" key="consi_de^ranter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consīdĕranter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. considero <sense id="n10497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>, A.</sense></entryFree>
considerantia: <entryFree id="n10498" type="hapax" key="consi_de^ranti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consīdĕrantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>considero, II.</etym>, <sense id="n10498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consideration, reflection</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 1, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
considerate: <entryFree id="n10499" type="main" key="consi_de^ra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consīdĕrātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. considero <sense id="n10499.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>, B., <pos>adv.</pos></sense></entryFree>
consideratio: <entryFree id="n10500" type="main" key="consi_de^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consīdĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>considero, II.</etym>, <sense id="n10500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">contemplation, consideration, reflection</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Quint.): consideratio contemplatioque naturae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 41, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accurata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:33:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 33, 103</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subtilior verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:29" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 29</bibl></cit> (28), 6.</sense></entryFree>
considerator: <entryFree id="n10501" type="main" key="consi_de^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consīdĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who considers, reflects</hi> (post-class., and very rare); transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">skeptiko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a sceptic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:5:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 5, 2</bibl>; Aug. Tract. ap. Joann. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
consideratus: <entryFree id="n10502" type="main" key="consi_de^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consīdĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from considero.</entryFree>
considero: <entryFree id="n10503" type="main" key="consi_de^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sīdĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>acc. to Corss. Nachtr. p. 43, from sidus, prop. to observe the stars; and so Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=42:4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 42, 4</bibl>, and 75, 8 Müll.; cf. desidero</etym>, <sense id="n10503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to look at closely, attentively, carefully, to inspect, examine</hi> (class. in prose and poetry, esp. in the trop. signif.). </sense><sense id="n10503.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">contemplari unum quidque otiose et considerare coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:15:section=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 15, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candelabrum etiam atque etiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 28</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">65: argentum (with contemplari),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">33: opus (pictorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:147" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 41, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 58:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 58, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallium diligentius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 12, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:27:section=63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 27, § 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">feminas diligenter ac lente mercantium more,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formam, quā ludum gladiatorium erat aedificaturus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucentia sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:21:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:95 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 95 al.</bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n10503.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> as object, <hi rend="ital">to observe, perceive</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cum folia decidere considerassent (corresp. with videre and animadvertere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:67" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10503.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">num tamen exciderit ferrum considerat, hastae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 105</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10503.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to consider maturely, to reflect, contemplate, meditate;</hi> constr. with the <case>acc.</case>, with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause, ut</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10503.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mecum in animo vitam tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">eos casus mecum ipse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquum est, quod ipsae optime considerabitis, vestri similes feminae sintne Romae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res atque pericula nostra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul ipse qui suadet considerandus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 76</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rosciorum factum ex ipsius Chrysogoni judicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:37:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 37, 108</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">aliquid ex aliquā re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ex se et ex suā naturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:10:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 10, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 58, 176</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10503.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de me ipso ac de meis te considerare velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his de rebus velim cum Pomponio consideretis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quā (intercessione) isti ipsi considerabunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:19:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 19, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de totā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 24, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quale sit id, de quo consideretur,</quote> <trans><tr>inquiry is made</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:4:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 4, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10503.7" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">considerate cum vestris animis vosmet ipsi, ecquem putetis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:12:section=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 12, § 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed velim consideres, quid faciendum putes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 13, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:68:section=174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 68, § 174</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 12, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consideres quid agas, quo progrediare, quem hominem et quā ratione defendas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Verr 2, 5, 68, § 174</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:51 al" default="NO">3, 8, 51 al.</bibl>: finitimos hostes an amicos velis<cb n="CONS" />  esse considera, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:8:30" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 8, 30</bibl>.—So <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quā (parte) quid juris sit consideratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:11:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 11, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10503.8" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne, to take care, to be considerate</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">considerandum erit, ut solum pingue sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ut lunā crescente id fiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">considerandum est, ne aut temere desperet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:21:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 21, 73</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille se considerare velle (ait),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 16, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10503.9" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sīdĕranter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (of the <pos>P. a.</pos> considerans. which is not used), = considerate, <hi rend="ital">in a deliberate, considerate manner</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 1</bibl></cit>, Ambust. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">cuneum deponere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 17, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> considerantius, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, p. 2194" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, p. 2194</bibl> P., but without voucher.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> not in use.— </sense><sense id="n10503.10" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">consīdĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, in acc. with 11., <hi rend="ital">maturely reflected upon, considerate, circumspect, cautious</hi>, etc. (in good prose; most freq. in Cic.; not in Quint.). </sense><sense id="n10503.11" n="1" level="3"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum consideratissimum, arbitror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 9, 19</bibl></cit> (v. arbitror, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">considerata atque provisa via vivendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:1:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 5, 1, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">considerata (et diligens) excogitatio faciendi aliquid aut non faciendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:5:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 26, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54:164" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 54, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tarditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:42:154" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 42, 154</bibl></cit>: facilitas parum considerata, Cod. Th. 8, 5, 19.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 2</bibl></cit>, a, 2.—</sense><sense id="n10503.12" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, as in Engl., to the person: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 3, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consideratus ac sapiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:44:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 44, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardum pro considerato vocent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 39, 20</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: consideratior factus Caesar (with tardior), Auct. B. Afr. 73; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">unā in re paulo minus consideratus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 3, 11</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">consīdĕrātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">considerately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fieri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 16, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:38:136" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 38, 136</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 27, 94</bibl></cit> al.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:45:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 45, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:77" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 77</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consido: <entryFree id="n10504" type="main" key="consi_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sīdo</orth>, <itype>sēdi</itype> (also -sīdi, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 7</bibl>, v. Sat., v. 14 Vahl.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:4:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 4, 1</bibl>; cf. Wagner ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 1</bibl>; Neue, Formenl. II. p. 501), sessum, 3, <sense id="n10504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to sit down</hi> (esp. of a multitude), <hi rend="ital">take a seat, be seated, to settle</hi> (freq. in all periods and species of composition); constr. with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">abl., sub</hi> and <hi rend="ital">abl., ante</hi>, the simple <case>abl.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10504.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10504.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10504.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutatio hospitalis ... fuit, positisque sedibus consederunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:39:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 39, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scio apud vos filio in conspectu matris nefas esse considere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:2:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi jussi considere affirmant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:6:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec aut recubet aut considat pastor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:26" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix consideramus, et nox, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:20:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 20, 14</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10504.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With designation of place: <cit><quote lang="la">si videtur, considamus hic in umbrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in pratulo propter Platonis statuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:6:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certo in loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:18:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 18, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in molli herbā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in illo caespite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:931" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 931</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">examen in arbore consederat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:46:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 46, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rupe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sellā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:2:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in turre consedit avis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dormienti in labellis (apes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 36, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub argutā ilice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic corylis mixtas inter ulmos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante focos scamnis longis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:305" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super ripam stagni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:373" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 373</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transtris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 573</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsae (apes) medicatis sedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solio medius consedit avito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mecum saxo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:679" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 679</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tergo tauri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:869" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 869</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in silvam venitur et ibi considitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 5, 18</bibl></cit>.—Of soldiers in battle array: <cit><quote lang="la">triarii sub vexillis considebant, sinistro crure porrecto, scuta innixa umeris ... tenentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10504.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10504.6" n="1" level="3"> In assemblies of the people, courts of justice, theatres, etc., <hi rend="ital">to take one's place, take a seat, sit, hold sessions, to be in session</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in theatro imperiti homines consederant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 7, 16</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of senators,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 35</bibl></cit>.—Of judges: <cit><quote lang="la">quo die primum judices, citati in hunc reum consedistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:7:section=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 7, § 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:48:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 48, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 157</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 627</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad jus dicendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:61:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 61, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">introductum in tabernaculum (Persea) adversus advocatos in consilium considere jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 7, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in orchestrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter patres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10504.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to encamp, pitch a camp, take post somewhere;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo in loco Germani consederant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 49</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 49:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 49, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:17:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 17, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 4, 11</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">sub</hi>: sub <cb n="CONS" /> monte consedit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 57:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 57, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">trans flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra eum duūm milium spatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntiant Jugurtham circiter duūm milium intervallo ante eos consedisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 106:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 106, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope Cirtam haud longe a mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter virgulta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 49:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 49, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superioribus locis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 51:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 51, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi cuique vallis abdita spem praesidii aut salutis aliquam offerebat, consederat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:31" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 7, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud procul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:12:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 12, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10504.8" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To settle down for a long time</hi> or <hi rend="ital">permanently, to take up one's abode, to establish one's self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui etiam dubitem, an hic Antii considam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antequam aliquo loco consedero, neque longas a me neque semper meā manu litteras exspectabis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Belgas propter loci fertilitatem ibi consedisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Ubiorum finibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultis et his mecum pariter considere regnis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:572" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 572</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 349</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in novam urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10504.9" n="4" level="3"> Of inanim. objects, esp. of places, <hi rend="ital">to settle, sink down, sink in, give way, subside</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">in Veliterno agro terra ingentibus cavernis consedit arboresque in profundum haustae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:38:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 38, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">terra in ingentem sinum consedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Alpes) jam licet considant!</quote> <trans><tr>may now sink down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 14, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne mihi visum considere in ignis Ilium,</quote> <trans><tr>to sink down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:624" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 624</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 145</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Ilium ardebat, neque adhuc consederat ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 408</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in cinerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:185" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnia sacra profanaque in ignem considerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: quā mitescentia Alpium juga considunt, <hi rend="ital">sink</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">are lower</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 25, 28, § 147</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patiemur picem considere, et cum siderit, aquam eliquabimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:24:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec consideret pulvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:13:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 13, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in cacuminibus montium nubes consident,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 82, § 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumidi considunt fluctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:291" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 291</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10504.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10504.11" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">multa bona in pectore consident,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitia cujus in mente consedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:12:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 12, 24</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: totam videmus Consedisse urbem luctu, <hi rend="ital">sunk</hi> or <hi rend="ital">immersed in grief</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 350</bibl> (in luctum esse demersum, Serv.). —</sense><sense id="n10504.12" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10504.13" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B. 3.) <hi rend="ital">To settle down permanently, sink</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in otio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc totum (genus dicendi) in eā mediocritate consedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:27:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 27, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antequam ego incipio secedere et in aliā parte considere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>change the subject</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 117:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 117, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10504.14" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B. 4.) <hi rend="ital">To lose force, abate, subside, diminish; to be appeased, quieted, to cease</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardor animi cum consedit, omnis illa vis et quasi flamma oratoris exstinguitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:24:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 24, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consederit furor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 27, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferocia ab re bene gestā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:62:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 62, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primus terror ab necopinato visu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:218" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia praesentia satis consederant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consedit utriusque nomen in quaesturā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>has since that time ceased</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 8, 18</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10504.15" n="b" level="4"> Of discourse, <hi rend="ital">to sink; to conclude, end</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum verborum junctio nascatur a proceris numeris ac liberis... sed varie distincteque considat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:49:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 49, 191</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consignate: <entryFree id="n10505" type="main" key="consigna_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consignātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. consigno, <sense id="n10505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
consignatio: <entryFree id="n10506" type="main" key="consigna_ti_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consignātīo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>consigno</etym>, <sense id="n10506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a written proof, a document</hi> (post-class. and rare), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 11</bibl> Spald.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:3:4 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 3, 4 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:10:16:section=2 al" default="NO">48, 10, 16, § 2 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
consignatus: <entryFree id="n10507" type="main" key="consigna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consignātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from consigno.</entryFree>
consigno: <entryFree id="n10508" type="main" key="consigno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-signo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n10508.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To furnish with a seal, to affix, put one's seal to, to seal, to sign, subscribe</hi> (in good prose). </sense><sense id="n10508.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">tabellas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulas signis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudatio consignata cretā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id decretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:48:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 48, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">conscripta consignataque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 12, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:19:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 19, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:1:24" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 28, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabellas dotis,</quote> <trans><tr>a marriage contract</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 29</bibl></cit> (for which, briefly, dotem, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 26</bibl>): tabulas proprio lino, propriāque cerā, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 181</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:1:64" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 1, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10508.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to attest, certify, establish, vouch for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">monumentis testata consignataque antiquitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:40:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 40, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatūs judicia, quae publicis populi Romani litteris monumentisque consignata sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <pb n="432" /> <cb n="CONS" /> auctoritates nostras, <hi rend="ital">to place beyond doubt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:50:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 50, 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 11, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 9, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10508.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To note, write down, to register, record</hi> (so lit. aud trop.; for the most part only in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n10508.4" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">litteris aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundos publicis commentariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:55:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 55, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam publicam (legum) publicis litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:20:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 20, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motum temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 9 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10508.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: tot rerum atque tantarum insitae et quasi consignatae in animis notiones. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:24:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 24, 57</bibl>: causam, de quā, etc., <hi rend="ital">to make known, indicate</hi> (with exprimere), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 17</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">consignātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (of the <pos>P. a.</pos> consignatus, a, um, not in use; Hertz, consignatius); <cit><quote lang="la">acc. to II.,</quote> <trans><tr>in a distinct manner, plainly, distinctly; comp</tr>.,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:25:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 25, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus consignatissime factus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. the preced.</sense></entryFree>
consilesco: <entryFree id="n10509" type="main" key="consi^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sĭlesco</orth>, <itype>sĭlŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n., to become still, to be hushed, keep silent, grow dumb</hi> (ante- and post-class.), Enn. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=58:9" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 58, 9</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 575 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:1:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:22" default="NO">12, 1, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consiliarius: <entryFree id="n10510" type="main" key="consi^li^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consĭlĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>consilium</etym>, <sense id="n10510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">suitable for counsel, counselling</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n10510.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis consiliarius amicus quam auxiliarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">particeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:3:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:39:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 39, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. Müll. Etrusk. 2, p. 168.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">consĭlĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a counsellor, adviser</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consiliario et auctore Vestorio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 19, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Verris) amici et consiliarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:17:section=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 17, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">AVGVSTI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2648</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:56" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 56</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10510.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n10510.3" n="A" level="2"> T. t., <hi rend="ital">an assessor, aid in a court of justice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10510.4" n="B" level="2"> Of the augur as the <hi rend="ital">interpreter</hi> of the divine will: <cit><quote lang="la">consiliarius atque administer Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:19:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 19, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consiliatio: <entryFree id="n10511" type="main" key="consi^li^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consĭlĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>consilior</etym>, <sense id="n10511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a consulting, counselling</hi>, Jul. Vict. Art. Rhet. 14 Mai, dub.</sense></entryFree>
consiliator: <entryFree id="n10512" type="main" key="consi^li^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consĭlĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10512.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a counsellor</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">maleficus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consiliator et rector,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 107, 36</bibl></cit>.—As an epithet of Jupiter, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Gud.</author> p. 7</bibl>, n. 6.</sense></entryFree>
consiliatrix: <entryFree id="n10513" type="hapax" key="consi^li^a_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consĭlĭātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>consiliator</etym>, <sense id="n10513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who counséls</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illae consiliatrices tuae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 169, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consiligo: <entryFree id="n10514" type="main" key="consi^li_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sĭlīgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n10514.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lungwort</hi>: Pulmonaria officinalis, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:5:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:14:1" default="NO">6, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 48, § 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:38 al" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 7, 21, § 38 al.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 1, 12, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consilinum: <entryFree id="n10515" type="main" key="Consi^li_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Consĭlīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n10515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fortified town in Bruttium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 10, 15, § 95</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>:</sense></entryFree>
consilinas: <entryFree id="n10516" type="main" key="Consi^li_na_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Consĭlīnās</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n10516.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of Consilinum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 8, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consilior: <entryFree id="n10517" type="main" key="consi^li^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consĭlĭor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>consilium</etym>. <sense id="n10517.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To take counsel, to consult</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">consiliandi causā colloqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficilis ad consiliandum legatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 53</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n10517.1" n="II" level="1"> Alicui (prop. to take counsel for one, in one's favor; hence), <hi rend="ital">to impart counsel, to counsel, advise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 196</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consiliosus: <entryFree id="n10518" type="main" key="consi^li^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consĭlĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of prudence</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wisdom, considerate</hi>, etc., a word formed, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:9:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 9, 12</bibl>, by Cato (mostly post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">exempla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Ep. ad Ver. 1" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Ep. ad Ver. 1</bibl></cit> (in imitation of Cato).—* <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 9</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consilium: <entryFree id="n10519" type="main" key="consi^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consĭlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>from con and root sal-; Sanscr. sar-; cf. consul</etym>, <sense id="n10519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deliberation, consultation, a considering together, counsel</hi> (cf. concilium; very freq. in all periods and species of composition). </sense><sense id="n10519.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">consulta sunt consilia,</quote> <trans><tr>are finished, at an end</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid in consilio consuluistis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit> Ritschl: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium volo capere unā tecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque pol consili locum habeo neque ad auxilium copiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 2, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo consilia conferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:15:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 15, 38</bibl></cit> (v. confero, I. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">saepe in senatu consilia versata sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:2" default="NO">7, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi vero consilii sit res, et non necesse sit, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>as if the matter were yet open for deliberation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid efficere possis, tui consilii est,</quote> <trans><tr>is for you to consider</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestrum jam consilium est. non solum meum, quid sit vobis faciendum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: quid aetati credendum sit, quid nomini,<cb n="CONS" />  magni consilii est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 12, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil mihi adhuc accidit, quod majoris consilii esset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in consilio habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fit publici consilii particeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:4" default="NO">3, 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 42:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 42, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcanis ut interesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 18, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n10519.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10519.3" n="A" level="2"> In abstr. </sense><sense id="n10519.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A conclusion made with consideration, a determination, resolution, measure, plan, purpose, intention</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:5:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 5, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium est aliquid faciendi aut non faciendi excogitata ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:25:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 25, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 9, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">certum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">callidum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sunt Gallorum subita et repentina consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid communi consilio agere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium communicaverunt perfeceruntque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificandi consilium abicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 11, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 41, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
