C. 3, 103</bibl></cit>.—And of the <hi rend="ital">purpose.</hi> as opp. to the act, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod initio scripsi, totius facti tui judicium non tam ex consilio tuo quam ex eventu homines esse facturos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi exitus rerum, non hominum consilia, legibus vindicentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentem peccare, non corpus, et unde consilium afuerit culpam abesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:58:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 58, 9</bibl></cit>. —Often with epithets characterizing the person who forms the purpose, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">amentissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 10 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:38:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 38, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:32:13" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 32, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortissima cousilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:38:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 38, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidele,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:4:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">providens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:7:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:5:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temerarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:120:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 120, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incautum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repudio quod consilium primum intenderam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo consilio, uti frumento Caesarem intercluderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:21:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 21, 72 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 57:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 57, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo consilio huc imus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also: hoc consilio ut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: privato consilio, <hi rend="ital">on one's own account</hi> (opp. publico consilio, in the name or behalf of the state): <cit><quote lang="la">qui contra consulem privato consilio exercitus comparaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 1, 2</bibl>.—Sometimes <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> consilio adverbially, <hi rend="ital">intentionally, designedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">casu potius quam consilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul, seu forte, seu consilio, Venusiam perfugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:49:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 49, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 14, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 216</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10519.5" n="b" level="4"> Esp. in the phrases, </sense><sense id="n10519.6" n="(a)" level="5"> Consilium capere, <hi rend="ital">to form a purpose</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plan, to resolve, decide, determine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque, quid nunc consili capiam, scio, De virgine istac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: consilium capere with a <hi rend="ital">gen. gerund.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 11, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:51:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 51, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 34, 4</bibl>; 10, 38, 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 16, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:6:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:7:1" default="NO">8, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:180" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 180</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:13:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 13, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:4:1" default="NO">34, 4, 1</bibl>; cf. with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">profectionis et reversionis meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 16, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:11:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 11, 6 al.</bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capio consilium, ut senatum congerronum convocem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium ceperunt plenum sceleris, ut nomen hujus deferrent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 10, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:54:section=140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 54, § 140</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium cepi, ut antequam luceret exirem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:chapter=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7</bibl></cit>. 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,006:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tull. 14, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 34, 7</bibl>.—And with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium cepit ... iter in urbem patefacere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominis fortunas evertere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 16, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Heraclius capit consilium ... non adesse ad judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:17:section=41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 17, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex oppido profugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 35, 1, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10519.7" n="(b)" level="5"> In the same sense, inire consilium, with similar construction: <cit><quote lang="la">inita sunt consilia urbis delendae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:37:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 37, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">38, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regni occupandi consilium inire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 17, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:38:5" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 38, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus gentium cujus violandi causā consilium initum erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:25:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 25, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 11, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleris conandi consilia inierat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:35:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 35, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:80:6" default="NO">2, 80, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeci consilium ineunt interrumpendi pontis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:13:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 13, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniit consilia reges Lacedaemoniorum tollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia inibat, quemadmodum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de bello consilia inire incipiunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de recuperandā libertate consilium initum videretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia inita de regno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atrox consilium init, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10519.8" n="(g)" level="5"> Freq. consilium est, with and without <hi rend="ital">inf., I purpose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:53:6" default="NO" valid="yes">53, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:63:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 63, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 4:61:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 4, 61, 16</bibl> Dietsch. <cb n="CONS" /> —Rarely with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut filius Cum illà habitet ... hoc nostrum consilium fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea uti acceptā mercede deseram, non est consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 8</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid sui consilii sit, ostendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 21</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10519.9" n="c" level="4"> In partic., in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a warlike measure, device, stratagem</hi>: consilium imperatorium quod Graeci <foreign lang="greek">strath/ghma</foreign> appellant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:6:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 6, 15</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Iphicr. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Iphicr. 1, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">opportunus consiliis locus (= insidiis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10519.10" n="d" level="4"> With special reference to the person for whose advantage a measure is devised, <hi rend="ital">counsel, advice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu quidem antehac aliis solebas dare consilia mutua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 98</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid das consili?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cethegum minus ei fidele consilium dedisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:31:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 31, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos lene consilium datis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 45</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">juvabo aut re aut operā aut consilio bono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">imitated by Ter.: aut consolando aut consilio aut re juvero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 34</bibl></cit> (quoted ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 10, 4</bibl>); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 31, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te hortor ut omnia moderere prudentiā tuā, ne te auferant aliorum consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin aliquid impertivit tibi sui consilii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consiliis, non curribus utere nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile ratio tam salubris consilii accepta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:7:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saniora consilia pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10519.11" n="2" level="3"> As a mental quality, <hi rend="ital">understanding, judgment, wisdom, sense, penetration, prudence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et dominari in corpore toto Consilium quod nos animum mentemque vocamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 139</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:450" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 450</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acta illa res est animo virili, consilio puerili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 21, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 7, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut popularis cupiditas a consilio principum dissideret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:49:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 49, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majore studio quam consilio ad bellum proficisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:96:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 2, 96, 4</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">res forte quam consilio melius gestae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 92:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 92, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae quanto consilio gerantur, nullo consilio adsequi possumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:38:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 38, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul consilium cum re amisisti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">miseros prudentia prima relinquit, Et sensus cum re consiliumque fugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:12:48" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 12, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieres omnes propter infirmitatem consilii majores in tutorum potestate esse voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir et consilii magni et virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum plus in illo senili animo non consilii modo sed etiam virtutis esse dicerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 13, 13</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tam iners, tam nulli consili Sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est hoc principium improbi animi, miseri ingenii, nulli consilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:16:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 16, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes gravioris aetatis, in quibus aliquid consilii aut dignitatis fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">misce stultitiam consiliis brevem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae res in se neque consilium neque modum Habet ullum, eam consilio regere non potes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10519.12" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., of inanim. things: <cit><quote lang="la">consilii inopes ignes,</quote> <trans><tr>indiscreet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:746" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 746</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis consili expers,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 266</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10519.13" n="B" level="2"> In concr., <hi rend="ital">the persons who deliberate, a council;</hi> of the Roman senate: <cit><quote lang="la">senatum, id est orbis terrae consilium, delere gestit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 4, 6, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:82:333" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 82, 333</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:65:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 65, 137</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">summum consilium orbis terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 7, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 22, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:8:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 8, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">di prohibeant, ut hoc, quod majores consilium publicum vocari voluerunt, praesidium sectorum existimetur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a court of justice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:52:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 52, 151</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ex civitate in senatum propter dignitatem, ex senatu in hoc consilium delecti estis propter severitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—Of the division of the centumviri, who sat for ordinary cases in four consilia: <cit><quote lang="la">sedebant centum et octoginta judices, tot enim quattuor consiliis colliguntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 33, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus non solum consiliis sed etiam sententiis superior discessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:7:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galba consilio celeriter convocato sententias exquirere coepit,</quote> <trans><tr>a council of war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">consilio advocato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 31, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:22:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 22, 9 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">castrense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:35:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 35, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittunt (Carthaginienses) triginta seniorum principes: id erat sanctius apud illos consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 16, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 34, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 25, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum atque sapientium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:2 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 2 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10519.14" n="b" level="4"> Facetiously: <cit><quote lang="la">paulisper tace, Dum ego mihi consilia in animum convoco, et dum consulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10519.15" n="c" level="4"> (Acc. to II. A. <pb n="433" /> <cb n="CONS" /> 1. c.) <hi rend="ital">A counsellor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille ferox hortator pugnae consiliumque fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:2:32" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Clymene, Aethraque, Quae mihi sunt comites consiliumque duae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 16</bibl></cit> (17), 268; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:276" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 276</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consimilis: <entryFree id="n10520" type="main" key="consi^mi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sĭmĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <sense id="n10520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., similar in all respects, entirely similar, like</hi> (class.; most freq. in Plaut., Ter., and Lucr.; not in Hor.); constr. with <hi rend="ital">gen., dat., atque, quasi</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10520.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liber captivus avis ferae consimilis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 193</bibl> P. (Com. Rel. v. 397 Rib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:811" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 811</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:711" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 711</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 149</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n10520.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui homini erus est consimilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 12, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10520.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">atque</hi> or <hi rend="ital">et</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam consimili'st atque ego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 287</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Or. 1" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Or. 1</bibl>; and with <hi rend="ital">et</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 8</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">que</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 231</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n10520.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quasi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia consimile est quom stertas quasi sorbeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: via, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 316, 9</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 135 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">pars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1018" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1018</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:736" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 736</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:916" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 916</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:842" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 842</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:884" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 884</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1097" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 1097</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ratione mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:676" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 676</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:7:3" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: studio, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 13</bibl>: pariter cadentia et consimilia irascentem, etc., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:102" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 102</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) In a doubtful constr.: <cit><quote lang="la">fecerunt, ut consimilis fugae profectio videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quojus mos maxumest consimilis vostrum, hi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sĭmĭlĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>; only in the phrase et consimilia, after enumerations, <hi rend="ital">and the like, and similar things</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saga, tunicae, paenulae et consimilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:23:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 23, § 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:102" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 102</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">consĭmĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very similarly, in like manner</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">consimiliter Cicero verbo isto utitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:16:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 16, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:5:8" default="NO">11, 5, 8</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> not in use either in <pos>adj.</pos> or <pos>adv.</pos></sense></entryFree>
consimiliter: <entryFree id="n10521" type="main" key="consi^mi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consĭmĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. consimilis <sense id="n10521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
consimilo: <entryFree id="n10522" type="main" key="consi^mi^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sĭmĭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype> <etym>consimilis</etym>, <sense id="n10522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to compare</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tantalum Jovi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 5</bibl></cit>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 2, 10.</sense></entryFree>
consipio: <entryFree id="n10523" type="main" key="consi^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consĭpĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>sapio</etym>, <sense id="n10523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be in one's right mind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in one's senses, to be of sound mind</hi> (rare and not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">non mentibus solum consipere, sed ne auribus quidem atque oculis satis constare poterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 42, 3</bibl></cit> Weissenb.: <cit><quote lang="la">non satis consipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6</bibl></cit> (7), 3, 12.</sense></entryFree>
consiptum: <entryFree id="n10524" type="main" key="consiptum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consiptum</orth>, v. consaepio <sense id="n10524.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
consistio: <entryFree id="n10525" type="main" key="consisti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consistĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>consisto</etym>, <sense id="n10525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a standing still</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <trans><tr>in a place</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:5:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 8, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consisto: <entryFree id="n10526" type="main" key="consisto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sisto</orth>, <itype>stĭti, stĭtum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to place one's self anywhere, to stand still, stand, halt, stop, make a stop</hi> (very freq. and class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n10526.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10526.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">jam hunc non ausim praeterire, quin consistam et conloquar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otiose nunc jam ilico hic consiste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi ad ipsum veni diverticulum, constiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti et viatores consistere cogant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque is (Demosthenes) consistens in loco, sed inambulans atque ascensu ingrediens arduo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ludius constitit aut tibicen repente conticuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 11, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 8, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plura scribam ad te cum constitero: nunc eram plane in medio mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: constitit nusquam primo quam ad Vada venit, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 13, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quibus oppidis consistere praetores et conventum agere solebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:11:section=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 11, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romae post praeturam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 39</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">101: ire modo ocius, interdum consistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in muro consistendi potestas erat nulli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes ordines, tota in illā contione Italia constitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:50:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 50, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad mensam consistere et ministrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:21:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 21, 61</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ramos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:510" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 510</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:766" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 766</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante torum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:653" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 653</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:674" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 674</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in medio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:601" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 601</bibl></cit>; and with a simple <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">limine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:486" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 486</bibl></cit>; 9, 397; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:123" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:541" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 541</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">post eum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 121:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 121, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calce aliquem super ipsum debere consistere,</quote> <trans><tr>trample on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:14:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 14, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10526.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10526.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To set, become hard</hi> or <hi rend="ital">solid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigore constitit Ister,</quote> <trans><tr>has been frozen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:10:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:662" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 662</bibl></cit>: sanguis, Poët. ap. Cic. <cb n="CONS" /> Tusc. 2, 17, 38: <cit><quote lang="la">alvus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 126</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">156, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum jam perfecte mustum deferbuit et constitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:21:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">album ex ovo, quo facilius consistat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:20:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 20, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10526.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Cum aliquo, to station</hi> or <hi rend="ital">place one's self with some one for conversation, to stand with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc jam loco cum altero Constitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:16 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 16 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hoc consistit, hunc amplexatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 7, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10526.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To take one's place, take position, assume a place</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attitude</hi> for an action, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">of a musician: ut constitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 21</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of an actor: in scaenā vero postquam solus constitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of an orator: in communibus suggestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aesopus mediā subito in turbā constitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 5, 29</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for shooting: post acer Mnestheus adducto constitit arcu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 507</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of athletes, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 426</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 20, 19, § 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter duas acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 19, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10526.7" n="4" level="3"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to halt, make a halt, take a position, to make a stand</hi> (opp. to a march, flight, or disorder): <cit><quote lang="la">locus, ubi constitissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in superiore acie constiterant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in sinistrā parte acies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fluctibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub muro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juxta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 26</bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">pro opere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 92:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 92, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites Ariovisti pari intervallo constiterunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constitit utrumque agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:46:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 46, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic regii constiterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:58:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 58, 10</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut reliquae (legiones) consistere non auderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in locis superioribus consistere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a fugā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:36:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 36, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves eorum nostris adversae constiterunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10526.8" n="5" level="3"> Jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to appear as accuser before a court of justice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum debitoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:3:49" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum matre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:7:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus dominos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:53" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 1, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10526.9" n="6" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fert animus propius consistere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>take a nearer view</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 467</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10526.10" n="7" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To have a stand</hi> as a dealer, <hi rend="ital">occupy a place of business</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ede ubi consistas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:296" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 296</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tabernā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 5</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">IN SCHOLA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4085</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">locum consistendi Romanis in Galliā non fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10526.11" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10526.12" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to rest, remain, stand</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 332</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 322</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patiamini eo transire illius turpitudinis infamiam, ubi cetera maleficia consistunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:30:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 30, 83</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut unde orta culpa esset, ibi poena consisteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 26, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante oculos rectum pietasque pudorque constiterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 73</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10526.13" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10526.14" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pause, to dwell upon, delay, stop</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in uno nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:38:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 38, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa mihi veritas manum inicit et paulisper consistere et commorari cogit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:16:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 16, 48</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:31:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 31, 124</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in singulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:35:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 35, 120</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista quae spectantur, ad quae consistitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 2:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10526.15" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B. 2.) <hi rend="ital">To be</hi> or <hi rend="ital">remain firm, unshaken, immovable, steadfast, to be at rest, to stand one's ground, to continue, endure, subsist, be, exist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mente consistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:28:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 28, 68</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">neque mente nec linguā neque ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclare in forensibus causis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 9, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dicendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:39:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 39, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbo quidem superabis me ipso judice, re autem ne consistes quidem ullo judice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:21:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 21, 59</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the cause itself: quia magistratus aliquis reperiebatur, apud quem Alfeni causa consisteret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 22, 71</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: modo ut tibi constiterit fructus otii tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo (viro) non modo culpa nulla, sed ne suspitio quidem potuit consistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:52:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 52, 152</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:29:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 29, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">confiteor ... me consistere in meo praesidio sic, ut non fugiendi hostis sed capiendi loci causā cessisse videar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:72:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 72, 294</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam consistere tutam,</quote> <trans><tr>to remain, continue safe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 11</bibl></cit> Lachm. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">constitit in nullā qui fuit ante color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt certi denique fines, Quos ultra citraque nequit consistere rectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quales cum vertice celso Aëriae quercus constiterunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:679" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 679</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo in loco, nullā in personā ... consistunt (ista quae vires atque opes humanae vocantur),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 9</bibl></cit>, ext. 7: spes est hunc miserum aliquando tandem posse consistere, <hi rend="ital">to take a firm stand</hi> (the figure derived from fleeing soldiers), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 30, 94</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si prohibent consistere vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 573</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10526.16" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Cum aliquo, to agree with</hi>: videsne igitur Zenonem tuum cum Aristone verbis consistere,<cb n="CONS" />  re dissidere, cum Aristotele et illis re consentire, verbis discrepare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:26:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 26, 72</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10526.17" n="4" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to be, exist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix binos oratores laudabiles constitisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:97:333" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 97, 333</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine agricultoribus nec consistere mortales nec ali posse manifestum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, praef. § 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadringentis centum Venerios non posse casu consistere,</quote> <trans><tr>to occur, lake place, be thrown</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:21:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 21, 48</bibl></cit>: summa studia officii inter nos certatim constiterunt, Lentul. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 34, 3</bibl>: sed non in te quoque constitit idem Exitus, <hi rend="ital">take</hi> or <hi rend="ital">have place</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 297</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10526.18" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in, ex</hi>, or the simple <case>abl.</case> (in Quint. also with <hi rend="ital">circa</hi> and <hi rend="ital">inter;</hi> <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <hi rend="ital">to consist in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of, to depend upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">major pars victūs eorum in lacte, caseo, carne consistit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis per se natura duabus Constitit in rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 420</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e quibus haec rerum summa consistat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 236</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:839" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 839</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:873 al" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 873 al.</bibl>; with <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">deveniunt in talis disposturas, Qualibus haec rerum consistit summa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1028" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 1028</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:61" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:66" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita omnis in venationibus atque in studiis rei militaris consistit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo salus et vita optimi cujusque consistit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc summa judicii causaque tota consistit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 9, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:40:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 40, 182</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam belli in personā tuā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 22, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quibus vita beata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:14:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in unā honestate omne bonum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 14, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nomine controversia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:57" default="NO">8, 3, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in actu rhetoricen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:18:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 18, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:42" default="NO">6, 3, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes omnis consistebat Datami in se locique naturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis quaestio circa res personasque consistere videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:19" default="NO">6, 3, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestio inter utile atque honestum consistet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 24</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10526.19" n="5" level="3"> As opp. to progressive motion, <hi rend="ital">to come to a stand, stand still, stop, rest, take rest, cease</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sola Ubi quiesco, omnis familiae causa consistit tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis administratio belli consistit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel concidat omne caelum omnisque terra consistat necesse est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:23:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 23, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forensium rerum labor et ambitionis occupatio constitisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <foreign lang="greek">dia/rroia</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 26, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">videndum, morbus an increscat, an consistat, an minuatur,</quote> <trans><tr>remains unchanged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus pituitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ad Trebiam terrestre constitisset bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:49:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 49, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum bellum Ligustinum ad Pisas constitisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 32, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">infractaque constitit ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 627</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gaius ejusque posteri in equestri ordine constitere usque ad Augusti patrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">maledictum, quod intra verba constitit,</quote> <trans><tr>stopped at, went no farther than</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 279" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 279</bibl></cit>.!*? Consisto as <pos>v. a.</pos> = constituo formerly stood <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 49:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 49, 6</bibl>; but these passages are corrected in recent editions. It is now found only <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:10:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 10, 9</bibl>, a doubtful passage, where Hertz reads: cum ad judices coniiciendae [consistendae] causae gratiā venissent.</sense></entryFree>
consistorianus: <entryFree id="n10527" type="main" key="consisto_ri^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consistōrĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>consistorium, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n10527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the emperor's cabinet</hi>: comitiva, Cod. 10, 30, 3.— Freq. comes, or <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">consistōrĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an assessor, aid in council</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">31, 12, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consistorium: <entryFree id="n10528" type="main" key="consisto_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consistōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>consisto</etym> (postclass.), <sense id="n10528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place of assembly</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10528.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., prop. of <hi rend="ital">the earth</hi>, as a dwelling-place of man, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10528.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">consistorium libidinum lupanar,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Uxor. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Spect. 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10528.3" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n10528.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A room where servants wait</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2</bibl>.—But most usually, </sense><sense id="n10528.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The place where the emperor's council met, the emperor's cabinet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Grat. Act. 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 7, 11</bibl>; Cod. Th. 6, 10, 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3184 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
consitio: <entryFree id="n10529" type="main" key="consi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. consero</etym>, <sense id="n10529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sowing, planting</hi>, perh. only in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consitor: <entryFree id="n10530" type="main" key="consi^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sower, planter</hi>: uvae (i.e. <hi rend="ital">Bacchus</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 14</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:63" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consitura: <entryFree id="n10531" type="hapax" key="consi^tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consĭtūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sowing, planting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 29</bibl></cit> (Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 195, 9</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
consitus: <entryFree id="n10532" type="main" key="consi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 1. consero.</entryFree>
consiva: <entryFree id="n10533" type="main" key="Consi_va"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Consīva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. consero</etym>, <sense id="n10533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who sows</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plants</hi>, an epithet of Ops, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=186:26" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 186, 26</bibl> Müll.—The same called <pb n="434" /> <cb n="CONS" /> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Consīvĭa</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 21</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 9, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consivius: <entryFree id="n10534" type="gloss" key="Consi_vi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Consīvĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. consero</etym>, <sense id="n10534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who sows</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plants</hi>, an epithet of Janus, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 15</bibl>; inscr. found near Rottenburg in 1847.</sense></entryFree>
consobrinus: <entryFree id="n10535" type="main" key="conso_bri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sōbrīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-a</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>soror</etym>. <sense id="n10535.0" n="I" level="1"> In a restricted sense, a designation of the children of two sisters, <hi rend="ital">the child of a mother's sister;</hi> but more freq. consobrini is used of <hi rend="ital">all cousins-german, the children of brothers</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sisters;</hi> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:1:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 1, § 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 9, 6, 14</bibl>.—In the former sense, <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 1, 2</bibl>.—In the latter, <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 17, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 4, 11</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:10:section=15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 10, § 15</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 4, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 2, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10535.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a relation, cousin</hi>, in any degree, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consocer: <entryFree id="n10536" type="main" key="conso^cer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sŏcer</orth>, <itype>ĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">-crus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>; a designation of the fathers and mothers of a married pair, <sense id="n10536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joint father-in-law</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mother-in-law; one of two fathers-in-law</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mothers-in-law; masc.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:1:32:section=20 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 1, 32, § 20 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Parent. Mart. 10, 33, 3</bibl>.—* <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Parent. 30</bibl> inscr.</sense></entryFree>
consociabilis: <entryFree id="n10537" type="hapax" key="conso^ci^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŏcĭābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>consocio</etym>, <sense id="n10537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">compatible, suitable, fit</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consociatim: <entryFree id="n10538" type="hapax" key="conso^ci^a_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŏcĭātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">together, unitedly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 11, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consociatio: <entryFree id="n10539" type="main" key="conso^ci^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŏcĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a union, association</hi> (several times in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewhere rare): consociatio hominum atque communitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:44:157" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 44, 157</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 28, 100</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 41, 149: gentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: sinistra siderum, Firm. 6, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
consociatus: <entryFree id="n10540" type="main" key="conso^ci^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŏcĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from consocio.</entryFree>
consocio: <entryFree id="n10541" type="main" key="conso^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sŏcĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to make common, to share with one, to associate, join, unite, connect</hi> (class.; most freq. in Cic., Livy, and Tac.; not in Quint. or Suet.); constr. with <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi>, or with <case>acc.</case> only. </sense><sense id="n10541.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero rectum est, cum amicis consociare aut conjungere injuriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:21:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 21, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:11:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 11, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Red. in Sen. 7, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:27:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 27, 13</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Themisto res consociata,</quote> <trans><tr>agreed upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furorem suum cum cive,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 25, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia cum iis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 44, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 18, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam major vester consensus in ullā causā fuit, numquam tam vehementer cum senatu consociati fuistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 4, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi sese sudor cum unguentis consociavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consociare mihi tecum licet,</quote> <trans><tr>to enter into partnership with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10541.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">centum Patres rem inter se consociant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 17, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:20:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 20, 66</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10541.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">consociare se pelago, of a river,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:16" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10541.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> only (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formam reipublicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audaces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos eorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: pinus et populus Umbram consociare amant, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusatorum atque indicum consociati greges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:2:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 6, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(sidera) tria consociata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:246" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ariarathes in omnia belli pacisque se consociaverat consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 29, 4</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">consŏcĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., united, agreeing, harmonious</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">dii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 45, 2</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consociatissima voluntas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> not in use.</sense></entryFree>
consocius: <entryFree id="n10542" type="main" key="conso^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sŏcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n10542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., united, connected</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">elementa sibi valde,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10542.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n10542.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">consŏ-cĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a partaker, aid, companion</hi> (with consortes), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 2, 3</bibl>; Firm. Math. 3, 13, 1.—</sense><sense id="n10542.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">consŏcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female companion, consort</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consors totius vitae et consocia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 9, 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consocrus: <entryFree id="n10543" type="main" key="conso^crus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŏcrus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. consocer.</entryFree>
consolabilis: <entryFree id="n10544" type="main" key="conso_la_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consōlābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>consolor</etym>, <sense id="n10544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to consolation</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10544.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass., that may be consoled, consolable</hi> (very rare): dolor, vix, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 3, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 8</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n10544.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., that brings consolation, consolatory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:19:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 19, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consolamen: <entryFree id="n10545" type="main" key="conso_la_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consōlāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10545.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consolation</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consolatio: <entryFree id="n10546" type="main" key="conso_la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consōlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a consoling, consolation, comfort</hi> (in good prose; most freq. in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n10546.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: uti consolatione,<cb n="CONS" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov.
