Cons. 7, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non egere consolatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:32:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 32, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:96:330" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 96, 330</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultam senectutem praeterita aetas nullā consolatione permulcere potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen. subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum tuarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epicuri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:22:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 22, 78</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:30:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 30, 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 32, 77</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10546.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a consolatory discourse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">treatise</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:55:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 55, 211</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:153" default="NO">11, 3, 153</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10546.3" n="II" level="1"> Esp., the title of a lost treatise of Cicero: De Consolatione, a fragm. of which is given by B. and K., Cic. Opera, xi. pp. 71-75.—</sense><sense id="n10546.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An encouraging, encouragement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">timoris,</quote> <trans><tr>an alleviating</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 17, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:38" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 38</bibl>; Auct. B. Alex. 8.</sense></entryFree>
consolativus: <entryFree id="n10547" type="main" key="conso_la_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consōlātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>consolor</etym>, <sense id="n10547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comforting, consolatory</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 2, 21, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consolator: <entryFree id="n10548" type="main" key="conso_la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consōlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who consoles, a comforter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:30:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 30, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Helv. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> ad Helv. 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consolatorie: <entryFree id="n10549" type="main" key="conso_la_to_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consōlātōrĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. consolatorius <sense id="n10549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
consolatorius: <entryFree id="n10550" type="main" key="conso_la_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consōlātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>consolor</etym>, <sense id="n10550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to consolation, consolatory, of consolation</hi> (rare): litterae, <hi rend="ital">letters of consolation</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 20, 1</bibl>: codicilli, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 10</bibl>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">consōlātōrĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a consolatory manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">compellare aliquem (opp. increpative),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consolida: <entryFree id="n10551" type="main" key="conso^li^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sŏlĭda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>solidus</etym>, <sense id="n10551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, also called</hi> conferva, <hi rend="ital">black briony, comfrey</hi>: Symphytum officinale, Linn.; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consolidatio: <entryFree id="n10552" type="main" key="conso^li^da_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŏlĭdātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>consolido</etym>; <sense id="n10552.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">jurid. t. t.,</quote> <trans><tr>a confirming, establishing of ownership</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:2:3:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 2, 3, § 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 2:4:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 2, 4, 3</bibl>; Fragm. Vat. § 83.</sense></entryFree>
consolidator: <entryFree id="n10553" type="hapax" key="conso^li^da_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŏlĭdātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a confirmer, fortifier</hi>: domūs, Ven. Carm. 1, 10, 22.</sense></entryFree>
consolido: <entryFree id="n10554" type="main" key="conso^li^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sŏlĭdo</orth>, no <sense id="n10554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ātum, 1, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to make firm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">solid, to make thick, condense</hi> (not ante - Aug.). </sense><sense id="n10554.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">parietem in unam crassitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10554.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">templa, saxa, marmora ferro plumboque consolidata ruunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 84:1" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 84, 1</bibl></cit>. —Jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to confirm, settle the usufruct</hi> or <hi rend="ital">the right of possession in a thing, to consolidate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:2:3:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 2, 3, § 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:2:6" default="NO">7, 2, 6</bibl> pr.; 23, 3, 78.</sense></entryFree>
consolidus: <entryFree id="n10555" type="spur" key="conso^li^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sŏlĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, a false read. for cum solidet, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, p. 153</bibl>.</entryFree>
consolo: <entryFree id="n10556" type="main" key="conso_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sōlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>collat. form of consolor</etym>, <sense id="n10556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cheer, comfort, console</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10556.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (ante - class. and very rare): per idem tempus Oedipus Athenas exul venire dicebatur, qui consolaret, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 473, 30</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 797</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n10556.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> in a <hi rend="ital">reflex.</hi> signif., <hi rend="ital">to console</hi> or <hi rend="ital">comfort one's self, find comfort in</hi>: cum animum vestrum erga me video, vehementer consolor, Q. Metell. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:13:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 13, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:13:6:section=1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 13, 6, § 1</bibl>; Asin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 792</bibl> P.—And in a <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: <cit><quote lang="la">sic consolatis militibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:6:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 22, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quibus viatores consolari solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 6:1" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 6, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consolor: <entryFree id="n10557" type="main" key="conso_lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sōlor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <sense id="n10557.0" n="I" level="1"> Of personal objects, <hi rend="ital">to console, encourage, animate, cheer, comfort</hi> (freq. and class.; most freq. in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n10557.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">istam, quod potes, Fac consolere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:578 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 578 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem de miseriis communibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Telamonem de Aiacis morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:29:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 29, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in miseriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc communi malo consoletur se conscientiā optimae mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:71:250" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 71, 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 7, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:14:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 14, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu velim Piliam meis verbis consolere,</quote> <trans><tr>in my name</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se per litteras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egomet, qui te consolari cupio, consolandus ipse eum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: his me consolor victurum suavius, ac si, etc., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vosmet ipsos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:28:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 28, 77</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">memet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ipse consolor maxime illo solacio, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 10, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque monere te audeo ... nec confirmare ... consolari vero nullo modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10557.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut consolando aut consilio aut re juvero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec igitur officia sunt consolantium, tollere aegritudinem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:31:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 31, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">librum mittere consolandi causa ad captivos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 22, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem tuum consolando levare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; Quint. <cb n="CONS" /> 11, 3, 64: <cit><quote lang="la">quo consolante doleres?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 360</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consolantia verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:491" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 491</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar ejus dextram prendit, consolatus rogat, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>encouraging him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:35:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 35, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:17:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 17, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:53 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 53 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10557.3" n="II" level="1"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">to mitigate, alleviate, lighten, relieve, soothe</hi> (most freq. in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut doloris magnitudinem celeritas, diuturnitatem adlevatio consoletur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:12:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 12, 40</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consolatur honestas egestatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 15, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incommodum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desiderium tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doloris magnitudinem brevitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:31:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 31, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevitatem vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:35:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 35, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi laborem delectatione oratoriā consolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 18, 2</bibl></cit> (16, 10): <cit><quote lang="la">hanc cladem domūs meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:41:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 41, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium nostrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 12, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut crudelitatem fati consolaretur aequalitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Polyb. 1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Polyb. 1</bibl></cit> (20), 3.</sense></entryFree>
consolutus: <entryFree id="n10558" type="main" key="conso^lu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sŏlūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [solvo], <sense id="n10558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dissolved together</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3:39" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 3, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:4:7:95" default="NO">4, 7, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:5:1:10" default="NO">5, 1, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consomnio: <entryFree id="n10559" type="hapax" key="consomni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-somnĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to dream of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consonans: <entryFree id="n10560" type="main" key="conso^nans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŏnans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, v. consono <sense id="n10560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
consonanter: <entryFree id="n10561" type="main" key="conso^nanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŏnanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. consono, <sense id="n10561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
consonantia: <entryFree id="n10562" type="main" key="conso^nanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŏnantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>consono</etym>, <sense id="n10562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an agreement, harmony, consonance</hi> (postAug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocum proximarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:20:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripturarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 11</bibl></cit> and 14.</sense></entryFree>
consonatio: <entryFree id="n10563" type="main" key="conso^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŏnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">resemblance of sound</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Anim. 12 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
consone: <entryFree id="n10564" type="main" key="conso^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŏnē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. consonus <sense id="n10564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
consono: <entryFree id="n10565" type="main" key="conso^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sŏno</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to sound at the same time</hi> or <hi rend="ital">together, to sound aloud, to resound</hi> (class., but rare till the Aug. period; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n10565.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10565.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">apes evolaturae consonant vehementer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:30" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omne tibiarum genus organorumque consonuit, fit concentus ex dissonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 84:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 84, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tubae utrimque canunt: contra consonat terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 73</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of places,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum plausu virūm Consonat omne nemus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 149</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:451" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 451</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consonuere cornicines funebri strepitu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 78, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consonante clamore nominatim Quinctium orare ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 34, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10565.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., in rhetor. </sense><sense id="n10565.4" n="1" level="3"> Of harmony in discourse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:73" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:45" default="NO">9, 3, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:77" default="NO">9, 3, 77</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10565.5" n="2" level="3"> Of similar terminations of words, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:75" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 75</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10565.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to agree, accord, harmonize</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quomodo inter se acutae ac graves voces consonent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quomodo animus meus secum consonet, id. ib: sibi in faciendis ac non faciendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:20:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi (tenor vitae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 31:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 31, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Capricorno (Virginis astrum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 2, 281</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 622</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc etenim contractui bonae fidei consonat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:48" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 1, 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:90" default="NO">35, 1, 90</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">consŏnans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n10565.7" n="A" level="2"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> (sc. littera; hence, <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">a consonant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:9" default="NO">1, 7, 9</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n10565.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">agreeing, consonant, fit, suitable</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">consonanti contractui bonae fidei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:2:34:section=8 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 2, 34, § 8 al.</bibl></cit>—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">consŏnanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">consonantly, agreeably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consonantissime ad harmoniam composita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consonus: <entryFree id="n10566" type="main" key="conso^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n10566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., sounding together in harmony, harmonious</hi> (rare, mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n10566.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">clangor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:610" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 610</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fila lyrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 8, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:448" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 448</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10566.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">consŏna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = consonans, <hi rend="ital">a consonant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1518,001:page=2395" default="NO"><author>Ter. Maur.</author> p. 2395</bibl> P. sq.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">consona elementa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1518,001:page=2385" default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 2385</bibl></cit> ib.—</sense><sense id="n10566.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">accordant, fit, suitable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fila telae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 42</bibl></cit>: credo Platonem vix putasse satis consonum fore, si, etc., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 114</bibl>. —With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consona regno juvenem docere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 69</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sŏnē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">harmoniously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamitare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 106, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consopio: <entryFree id="n10567" type="main" key="conso_pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sōpĭo</orth>, no <sense id="n10567.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ītum, 4, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to bring into an unconscious state, to put fast asleep, lull to sleep, to stupefy</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n10567.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">somno consopiri sempiterno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Endymion a Lunā consopitus putatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 38, 92</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:66:135" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 66, 135</bibl>: inter initia (veneni) consopitus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 44</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: (exstinctum lumen) consopit, <hi rend="ital">benumbs the senses</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:793" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 793</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10567.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of laws; <pb n="435" /> <cb n="CONS" /> <hi rend="ital">pass., to become obsolete</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnis illa XII. tabularum antiquitas ... consopita sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:10:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 10, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consors: <entryFree id="n10568" type="main" key="consors"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sors</orth>, <itype>sortis</itype>, <sense id="n10568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. m.</hi> and <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n10568.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Sharing property with one</hi> (as brother, sister, relative), <hi rend="ital">living in community of goods, partaking of in common</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consortes, ad quos eadem sors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=65" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 65</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=296:7" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 296, 7</bibl> ib.: <cit><quote lang="la">consortes tres fratres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:23:section=57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 23, § 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consortem socium fallere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 60</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">consors</orth>, <itype>sortis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a sharer, partner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consors censoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 27, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:10:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 10, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de consortibus ejusdem litis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (arx) data est heredibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 14</bibl></cit>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n10568.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a brother</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sister</hi>, regarded as common heirs, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora = sorores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 663</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:444" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 444</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sors</orth>, <itype>sortis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a brother, a sister</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romulus nondum fundaverat Moenia, consorti non habitanda Remo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:24" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 347</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 94</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consortem Phoebi colere deam (Dianam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:2:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 2, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:61 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 13, 61 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10568.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">dividing something with one, having an equal share, partaking of, sharing; subst., a colleague, partner, comrade</hi> (class.; esp. freq. after the Aug. per.). </sense><sense id="n10568.4" n="A" level="2"> Of personal subjects. </sense><sense id="n10568.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consors mecum temporum illorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:37:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 37, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriosi laboris (with socius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendacitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 15, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:492" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 492</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vitiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:94" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 319</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thalami,</quote> <trans><tr>a wife</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:246" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 246</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">socia tori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:521" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 521</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">sacrorum caerimoniarumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:7:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 7:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">generis et necis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:2:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuniciae potestatis (together with collega imperii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10568.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in lucris atque in furtis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:66:section=155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 66, § 155</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vis animi (cum corpore) ... nisi erit consors in origine primā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:771" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 771</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10568.7" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, of colleagues in power, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnisque potestas impatiens consortis erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 1</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> of that which is shared: <cit><quote lang="la">(corpus et animus) consorti praedita vitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 332</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10568.8" n="B" level="2"> Of things as subjects, <hi rend="ital">of the same condition, common</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:21:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 21, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consortalis: <entryFree id="n10569" type="hapax" key="consorta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consortālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>consortium</etym>, <sense id="n10569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to property held in common</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lineae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Colon. p. 111" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Colon. p. 111</bibl></cit> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
consortio: <entryFree id="n10570" type="main" key="consorti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consortĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>consors, II.</etym>, <sense id="n10570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fellowship, community, partnership, association</hi> (rare, but in good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">omnis humana dissolvetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sociabilis inter binos Lacedaemoniorum reges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 8, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuniciae potestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:99:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 99, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:103:2" default="NO">2, 103, 2</bibl>; and wholly <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaenam ista societas, quaenam consortio est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 40, 18</bibl></cit> (v. the passage in connection): <cit><quote lang="la">fati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:6:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(animalia terrestria) hominum quādam consortione degentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10570.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachus, cui cum vesicā quaedam consortio est,</quote> <trans><tr>sympathy, sympathetic connection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:27:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 27, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consortium: <entryFree id="n10571" type="main" key="consorti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consortĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>consors</etym> (not anteAug.). <sense id="n10571.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Community of goods</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntarium inter fratres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:52:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 2, 52, § 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10571.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Fellowship, participation, society</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:16:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 16, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:7:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:26:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 26, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:13:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 6, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:7:12:2" default="NO">7, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 48:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 48, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:73:7" default="NO">73, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:2:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 101, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 27, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 19, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epit. 42, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">53, 11</bibl>.— In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:9:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 9, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conspargo: <entryFree id="n10572" type="main" key="conspargo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspargo</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">consparsĭo</orth>, etc., v. conspergo, conspersio, etc.</entryFree>
conspatians: <entryFree id="n10573" type="hapax" key="conspa^ti^ans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-spătĭans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [spatior], <sense id="n10573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">walking together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter meretrices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conspectio: <entryFree id="n10574" type="main" key="conspecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conspicio</etym>, <sense id="n10574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a look, sight, view</hi> (late Lat. and rare for conspectus), Jul. Epit. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0594,001:57:section=201" default="NO"><author>Nov.</author> 57, § 201</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conspector: <entryFree id="n10575" type="main" key="conspector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who sees</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beholds; an inspector, beholder</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">cordis Deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Or. 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cult. Fem. 2, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conspectus: <entryFree id="n10576" type="main" key="conspectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from conspicio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10577" type="main" key="conspectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>conspicio</etym>, <sense id="n10577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seeing, looking at, a look, sight, view, the range</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reach of sight, the power of sceing</hi> (freq., and class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n10577.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cb n="CONS" /> casurusne in conspectum videatur animus, an tanta sit ejus tenuitas, ut fugiat aciem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:22:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 22, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo longissime conspectum oculi ferebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 18, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscuritas lucis Romanis non adimebat in omnis partes conspectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 41, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conspectu urbis frui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:41:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 41, 89</bibl></cit>: sese dare in conspectum, Enn. Ann. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare se in conspectum alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:33:section=86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 33, § 86</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui in conspectum prodire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodire ad aliquem in conspectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 5, 2, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paene in conspectu exercitūs nostri,</quote> <trans><tr>before the eyes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illam e conspectu amisi meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venire in conspectum alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:3:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 3, 3 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugere e conspectu alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:34:section=88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 34, § 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hominum conspectu morte decedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugare aliquem e conspectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conspectum fugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:594" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 594</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10577.2" n="2" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">public attention, notice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subito consilium cepi ut ante quam luceret exirem, ne qui conspectus fieret aut sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 10 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10577.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10577.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Presence, proximity</hi> (very freq.; in many connections coinciding with the foregoing, as the phrase venire in conspectum can be translated <hi rend="ital">to come before the eyes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to come near;</hi> so also e conspectu fugere, etc.). </sense><sense id="n10577.5" n="1" level="3"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi scio, eis fore meum conspectum invisum hodie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(tibi) cujus prope in conspectu Aegyptus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 5</bibl></cit>; so, in conspectu, <hi rend="ital">in the presence</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vicinity, before the eyes, before the face of, in sight</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 31, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 184</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10577.6" n="2" level="3"> Of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">quercus, quae est in oppidi conspectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procul a conspectu imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:32:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 32, 87</bibl></cit>: spectet patriam; <cit><quote lang="la">in conspectu legum libertatisque moriatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:66:section=170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 66, § 170</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10577.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Appearance</hi> (cf. adspectus; <cit><quote lang="la">very rare): videamus animi partis, quarum est conspectus inlustrior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:18:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 18, 48</bibl></cit> Madv. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Hieronymus ... primo statim aspectu omnia quam disparia essent ostendit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>at the first view the public had of him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 8, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10577.8" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the mental view, glance, survey, consideration</hi> (rare, but in good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">quae ponunt in conspectu animi, quae cernere et videre non possumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:40:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 40, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et cognitio naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:23:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 23, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uno in conspectu omnia videre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 4, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:5:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:4" default="NO">7, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 25, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ea ne in conspectu quidem relinquantur,</quote> <trans><tr>never come into consideration, are scarcely observed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:31:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 31, 93</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10577.9" n="B" level="2"> In Gellius concr., like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">su/noyis</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a short view, sketch, synopsis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:21:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:10:3" default="NO">19, 10, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conspergo: <entryFree id="n10578" type="main" key="conspergo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspergo</orth> (in MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">conspar-go</orth>; cf. 1. aspergo), <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>spargo</etym>. <sense id="n10578.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To sprinkle, moisten, besprinkle, bespatter, strew</hi> (very freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n10578.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10578.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">fores vino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aras multo sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram tabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 661</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me lacrimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:41:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 41, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnem sale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:55:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 55, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram rore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 8, 6, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen cinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 1, 2, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tracta placentae farinae L. II. (i. e. libris duabus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 76, 2 al.</bibl></cit>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbas viridantes floribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput Tauri stellis frequentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:43:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 43, 111</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10578.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Without <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">consperge (humum) ante aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">humum aestuantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vias propter pulverem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10578.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> of oratorical ornament, <hi rend="ital">to besprinkle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strew, to cover</hi> (the image taken from flowers): <cit><quote lang="la">(oratio) conspersa sit quasi verborum sententiarumque floribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:25:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 25, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae quādam hilaritate conspersimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10578.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To scatter, sprinkle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum vetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:39:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 39, 3</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
conspersio: <entryFree id="n10579" type="main" key="conspersi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspersĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">consparsĭo</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conspergo</etym> (late Lat.). <sense id="n10579.0" n="I" level="1"> Abstr., <hi rend="ital">a scattering, strewing, sprinkling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebra salis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 13, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10579.1" n="II" level="1"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">paste, dough</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 24 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
conspersus: <entryFree id="n10580" type="main" key="conspersus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspersus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">consparsus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from conspergo.</entryFree>
conspicabilis: <entryFree id="n10581" type="main" key="conspi^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspĭcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>conspicor</etym> (eccl. Lat.). <sense id="n10581.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Visible</hi>: ore, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 631. <cb n="CONS" /> —</sense><sense id="n10581.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Remarkable, notable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">thermae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 4 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
conspicabundus: <entryFree id="n10582" type="hapax" key="conspi^ca_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspĭcābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>conspicor</etym>, <sense id="n10582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">considering attentively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pallas virginem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 803</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conspiciendus: <entryFree id="n10583" type="main" key="conspi^ci^endus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspĭcĭendus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from conspicio.</entryFree>
conspicientia: <entryFree id="n10584" type="main" key="conspi^ci^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspĭcĭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conspicio</etym>, <sense id="n10584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the faculty of considering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum conspicien tiam habere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> An. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conspicillum: <entryFree id="n10585" type="main" key="conspi^cillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspĭcillum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-ĭlĭum</orth>, Plaut. Fragm ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 84, 7</bibl>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place to look from</hi>, and, transf., <hi rend="ital">a watching</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conspicillo consecutu'st me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 92</bibl></cit>; cf. unde conspici possis, Plaut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.</sense></entryFree>
conspicio: <entryFree id="n10586" type="main" key="conspi^ci^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-spĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>spexi, spectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n10586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to look at attentively, to get sight of, to descry, perceive, observe</hi> (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n10586.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10586.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10586.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter eas regiones, quā oculi conspiciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 9</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">in tabernam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 140, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10586.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me interrogas, Qui ipsus equidem nunc primum istanc tecum conspicio semul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae aedes ... quas quotiensquomque conspicio, fleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si queat usquam Conspicere amissum fetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 358</bibl></cit>: quandoque te in jure conspicio, Leg. Act. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 19, 54</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 12, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut procul novum vehiculum Argonautarum e monte conspexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:35:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 35, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quisque ... quae prima signa conspexit, ad haec constitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos cum apud se in castris Ariovistus conspexisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi primum nostros equites conspexerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 26: sidus in regione caeli, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 25, 23, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui lucus ex insulā conspiciebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conspici inter se,</quote> <trans><tr>to be visible to one another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:41:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 41, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum inter se conspecti essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc simulac cupido conspexit lumine virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conspectis luminibus crebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 24, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum insidiis conspeximus ipsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae mihi tunc primum, tunc est conspecta supremum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 526</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super tabernaculum ... unde ab omnibus conspici posset, imago Solis fulgebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conspecto delatore ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rugas in speculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 232</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua in undā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:640" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 640</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:794" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 794</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scopulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:731" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 731</bibl></cit>.—Of an inanimate subject: <cit><quote lang="la">si illud signum (Jovis) solis ortum et forum curiamque conspiceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 8, 20</bibl></cit>.—With two <hi rend="ital">accus.</hi>, when an action, condition, etc., is the object: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (matrem) paucis ante diebus laureatam in suā gratulatione conspexit, eandem, etc. ... eundem (filium) spoliatum omni dignitate conspiciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:41:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 41, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strata volgi pedibus detrita viarum Saxea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 315</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superiora loca multitudine armatorum completa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos laborantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquos ex nave egredientes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem conspiciens ad se ferentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves suas oppletas serpentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hann. 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Hannibalem) humi jacentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adrasum quendam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 49</bibl></cit>; cf., <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis non alius flectere equum sciens Aeque conspicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum interim Metellus, monte degrediens cum exercitu, conspicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 49:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 49, 5</bibl></cit> dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">v. conspicor: terribilior niger conspicitur (canis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10586.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus ut exanimum siquod procul ipse jacere Conspicias hominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:706" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 706</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nostros victores flumen transisse conspexerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centum procurrere currus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, 64, 389</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 9, 6, § 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10586.6" n="B" level="2"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to look at with admiration</hi> or <hi rend="ital">close attention, to gaze upon, observe, contemplate</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10586.7" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid nunc supina sursum in caelum conspicis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orabat, ne se, quem paulo ante cum egregiā stirpe conspexissent, orbum liberis facerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Demetrium ut pacis auctorem cum ingenti favore conspiciebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:53:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 53, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem cum omnes conspicerent propter novitatem ornatūs ignotamque formam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum bene notum Porticus Agrippae te conspexerit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10586.8" n="(b)" level="5"> Esp. <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: conspici, <hi rend="ital">to attract attention, to be conspicuous, noticed, observed, distinguished, admired</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inania sunt ista ... delectamenta paene puerorum, captare plausus, vehi per urbem, conspici velle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 25, 60</bibl></cit>: in gestu nec <pb n="436" /> <cb n="CONS" /> venustatem conspiciendam, nec turpitudinem esse, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 15, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic quisque hostem ferire, murum adscendere, conspici dum tale facinus faceret, properabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supellex modica, non multa, ut in neutram partem conspici posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid te ut regium juvenem conspici sinis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 47, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxime conspectus ipse est, curru equis albis juncto urbem invectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 23, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestitus nihil inter aequales excellens, arma atque equi conspiciebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:52:3" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 52, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 6, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum Conspicitur nitidis fundata pecunia villis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu formosissimus alto Conspiceris caelo ( = inter deos versaris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima bonis animi conspicerere tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:6:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 6, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:91:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 91, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:137" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 137</bibl>.—Less freq. in an unfavorable sense, <hi rend="ital">to be notorious, to be gazed at with dislike</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contempt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carere me adspectu civium quam infestis oculis omnium conspici mallem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: ne quid faciat, quod conspici et derideri posset, Aug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10586.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to perceive mentally, to understand, comprehend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis in rem quae sint meam ego conspicio mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum ego nunc corde conspicio meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut conspiciatis eum mentibus, quoniam oculis non potestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:20:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 20, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullus error talis in L. Aemilio Paulo conspectus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:5:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10586.10" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">conspĭcĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to II. B.), <hi rend="ital">having understanding, intelligent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quas (contumelias) despiciendas non sapiente opus est viro, sed tantum conspiciente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 16:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 16, 3</bibl></cit> Haase (al. consipiente). —</sense><sense id="n10586.11" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">conspectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n10586.12" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I. A. 1.) <hi rend="ital">Visible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumulus hosti conspectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 24, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 40, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 5, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmina inter se satis conspecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 4, 6</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10586.13" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B.) <hi rend="ital">Striking, distinguished, remarkable, gazed at</hi>, = conspicuus (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Pallas chlamyde et pictis conspectus in armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:588" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 588</bibl></cit> (conspicuus, conspicabilis, Serv.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">victor Tyrio in ostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 228</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:553" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 553</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patris avique fama conspectum eum faciebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conspectus elatusque supra modum hominis privati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 13, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:796" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 796</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:140 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 140 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> apparently not in use.—</sense><sense id="n10586.14" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">conspĭcĭendus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to I. B.), <hi rend="ital">worth seeing, worthy of attention, distinguished</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">insideat celeri conspiciendus equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:70" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nemesis donis meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hyas formā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:170" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater formosa Inter Dictaeos greges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eques,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus vel in hac magnificentiā urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:261" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 261</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:50:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 50, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10587" type="hapax" key="conspi^ci^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. conspicio</etym>, <sense id="n10587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the survey taken by the augur in fixing the limits of the</hi> templum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 9</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
conspicor: <entryFree id="n10588" type="main" key="conspi^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspĭcor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to get sight of, to descry, see, perceive</hi> (very freq. in Plaut. and Caes.; several times in Ter.; elsewh. rare; never in Lucr., Cic., Virg., or Hor.). </sense><sense id="n10588.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quemquam conspicor alium in viā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epidicumne ego conspicor?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante aedis erum meum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 2, 9: in tenebris conspicatus si sis me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Ajacem) occisum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 11, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 45 al.</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:8:25 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 8, 25 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc conspicatae naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10588.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic quis est, quem huc advenientem conspicor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perterritos hostes conspicati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 20, 1</bibl> and 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10588.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> as object: <cit><quote lang="la">illam geminos filios pueros peperisse conspicor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10588.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae res in nostris castris gererentur conspicati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 26</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">contempla et conspicare idem esse apparet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 9</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum interim Metellus ... conspicatur, primo dubius quidnam insolita facies ostenderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 49:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 49, 5</bibl></cit> Dietsch; Jacobs ad loc. (where MSS. have conspicitur, v. conspicio, I. A. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>; but cf. Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 102</bibl>).!*? <hi rend="ital">Pass., to be seen</hi>: ut nunc paupertas<cb n="CONS" />  conspicatur (<foreign lang="greek">qewrei=tai</foreign>), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 792</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
