consueo: <entryFree id="n10669" type="gloss" key="consu^e^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sŭĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <sense id="n10669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to be accustomed, be wont</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 224</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 885</bibl> ib. (for consuemus in Prop.; v. consuesco <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
consuesco: <entryFree id="n10670" type="main" key="consu^esco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭesco</orth>, <itype>suēvi, suētum, 3</itype> (in the <sense id="n10670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tempp. perff.</hi> the sync. forms prevail: consuesti, consuestis, consuerunt; consueram, etc.; consuero, etc.; consuerim, etc.; consuessem, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">consuesse. Thus also consuēmus = consuevimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:7:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 7, 5</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n10670.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to accustom, inure, habituate a person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi> (ante-class. and postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">tum bracchia consuescunt firmantque lacertos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 397</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvencum plostro aut aratro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem largo umori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina falcem pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 10, 14, § 70</bibl></cit>; in <hi rend="ital">perf. part. pass</hi>. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): qui consuetus in armis Aevom agere, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 21, 48</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 261 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">gallus auroram vocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:713" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 713</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 209</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:788" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 788</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consueta domi catulorum blanda propago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:997" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 997</bibl></cit> Lachm. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">copias habebat in Galliā bellare consuetas locis campestribus, Auct. B. Afr. 73, 2: quibus consueti erant uterque agrestibus ferramentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 40, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socors genus mancipiorum otiis, campo consuetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde ut consuetus antehac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus si perperam est consuetus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 5</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">grex comparatus ex consuetis unā (capellis),</quote> <trans><tr>those accustomed to one another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq. in all periods, </sense><sense id="n10670.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10670.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To accustom one's self;</hi> and (esp. freq.) in <hi rend="ital">temp. perf.</hi> (to have accustomed one's self, i. e.), <hi rend="ital">to be accustomed, to be wont;</hi> constr. in gen. with the <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, rarely <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, the <case>dat.</case>, or <case>abl.</case> </sense><sense id="n10670.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disjungamus nos a corporibus, id est, consuescamus mori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:31:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 31, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus multos uno spiritu pronuntiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 261</bibl></cit>: cum <cb n="CONS" /> minus idoneis (verbis) uti consuescerem, id <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 34, 154</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 22, 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alils parere suā vo luntate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui mentiri solet pe jerare consuevit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rose. Com. 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulatim Rhenum transire, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Britanniam navigare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsides accipere, non dare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo magno cum periculo mercatores ire consuerant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ipse procuratorem relinquere antea consuesset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 28, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuesso deos immortales ... his secundiores interdum res concedere, quos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 14</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quam rem pro magnis hominum officiis consuesse tribui docebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui reges consueris tollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier quae cum eo vivere consuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 10, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 12</bibl>.—Sometimes with ellips. of <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (cf. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign> infra): <cit><quote lang="la">quin eo (equo) quo consuevit libentius utatur (sc. uti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 19, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo die quo consuerat intervallo hostes sequitur (sc. sequi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 22</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">sicuti in sollemnibus sacris fieri consuevit,</quote> <trans><tr>is wont</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 22, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10670.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene salutando consuescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 69</bibl></cit> (cf. adsuescunt, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 65</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">pabulum quod dabis, amurcā conspergito, primo paululum, dum consuescant, postea magis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo in teneris consuescere multum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 272</bibl></cit>.— Usu. with <pos>adv.</pos> of manner or time: <cit><quote lang="la">si liberius, ut consuesti, agendum putabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: ut consuevi, Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 16, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut consuemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:7:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut consuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo minus pro capite et fortunis alterius, quemadmodum consuerunt, causam velint dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:15:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 15, 55</bibl>.—In Gr. attraction: cum scribas et aliquid agas eorum, quorum consuesti, gaudeo, Lucceius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 14, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10670.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aciem justam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 10, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10670.7" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (aves) consuevere libero victu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:13:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:153" default="NO">10, 153</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne gravissimo dolori timore consuescerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 23, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10670.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To have carnal in tercourse with, to cohabit with</hi>, in an honorable, or more freq. in a dishonorable sense (freq. and class.); with <hi rend="ital">aliquā</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aliquo</hi>, with or without <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid illi ... qui illā consuevit prior?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quācum tot consuesset annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4</bibl></cit>. 1, 40: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieres quibuscum iste consuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:12:section=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 12, § 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 70</bibl>; Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:23:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 23, 10</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in a double sense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 113</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 88</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭētus</orth> (in the poets trisyl.), a, um, <hi rend="ital">P. a.;</hi> of inanim. things which one is accustomed to, commonly employs, uses, possesses, etc., <hi rend="ital">used, accustomed; usual, ordinary, wonted, customary</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> G, 4, 429</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:3:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 3, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 266</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:491" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 491</bibl></cit>: canistris, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:74" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">finis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:242 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 242 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labores, pericula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 5, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:16:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Num. 16, 29</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetissima cuique Verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:638" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 638</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭētē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the usual manner, according to custom</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suscipere pabulum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
